episodes.title: WITNESSING CHANGE ~ with Ex-JW Activist SHAYNE MECHEN
episodes.description:
SHAYNE MECHEN is a former member of the Jehovah’s Witnesses, born into the group and eventually becoming an elder, before deciding to leave. 

Shayne is now an activist speaking out against high-control groups such as the JWs and an advocate for support and therapy for those affected by their experiences.

09:06 Marriage & Leaving

episodes.title: NEXT DOOR CULT - Escape from Family Abuse ~ KENDRA PETTY
episodes.description:
KENDRA PETTY is author of  ‘I Can't Believe I'm Not Dead’ --  a story partly about growing up in a home-grown cult where she endured seemingly unending abuses until she decided enough was enough and struck out on her own. 

Kendra returns to the show to go into even more detail about the church created by her mom and stepdad, and how she survived its incredible demands.

episodes.title: SCHOOL OF FEAR - The Rise of Christian Dominionism ~ JONATHON SAWYER
episodes.description:
JONATHON SAWYER is a Ph.D. candidate at the University of Colorado, researching and speaking out about religious and political extremism and its effect on schools and education.  

These concerns come from spending his formative years in a school associated with the New Apostolic Reformation – a movement that focuses on what it calls “spiritual warfare”.

episodes.title: Taking on the Two By Twos ~ with LAURA MCCONNELL CONTI
episodes.description:
LAURA MCCONNELL CONTI has appeared on Talk Beliefs twice before, speaking out about growing up fifth generation of the secretive Christian sect known as the Two By Twos.

In this new update we catch up with Laura's activism, including hearing about her ongoing work with the Redress Scheme of the Australian Royal Commission. 

And we’ll also find out if she thought the recent Hulu documentary on the Two by Twos was a successful exposé of the cult’s abuses … or a missed opportunity. 

#cults #belief #hulu

episodes.title: Memoir of a Queer Ex Jehovah's Witness ~ DANIEL ALLEN COX
episodes.description:
DANIEL ALLEN COX is a writer and public speaker having recently released his first autobiographical work, I Felt the End Before It Came: Memoirs of a Queer Ex-Jehovah's Witness. 

Daniel speaks candidly about growing up JW, being outed as gay, being made to feel inadequate because of his stutter, and the aftermath of leaving this extremely insular group...

episodes.title: CHURCH... OR CULT? - The Influence of Toxic Groups ~ with RICHARD TURNER
episodes.description:
Is that little church down the road not as innocent as it appears? How does the toxicity of cults filter down into today's mainstream churches?

RICHARD TURNER grew up near Liverpool, UK, and trained as a therapist before finding a placement within a charity linked to a church - a church that quickly seduced him into their ranks. Today he counsels people who have left cults, bringing his own unique perspective as a cult survivor to the table.

#cults #beliefs #pentecostal

04:39 Counselling ex cult members

episodes.title: Trans Panic? Debunking Transgender Myths ~ with PAULINE PARK
episodes.description:
PAULINE PARK is an activist and one of the founders of the New York Association for Gender Rights Advocacy, working in local government to fight for transgender rights.

In today’s interview, MARK from Talk Beliefs asks Pauline about the many misconceptions and false beliefs surrounding transgender people and the subject of transgender rights. 

We also hear Pauline's incredible story of starting out as a Korean adoptee and ending up as one of America’s most prominent voices for the trans community.

#belief #transgender #lgbt 


00:00 START

episodes.title: Why I Left the Seventh-day Adventist Church
episodes.description:
Today's interviewee wishes to remain anonymous. 

He got in touch with the show because he wanted to speak out about the controlling, cult-like behaviour he experienced during his several years as part of the Seventh Day Adventist church – a protestant church known for its observation of the Sabbath on Saturday rather than Sunday.

And, as a person with autism, he has a lot to say about how the SDA church treats people with special needs....

#autism #seventhdayadventist #cults

episodes.title: BREAKOUT - Escaping My Parents' Home Grown Cult ~ with KENDRA PETTY
episodes.description:
KENDRA PETTY began life by enduring years of childhood abuse, culminating in a stunning breakout from a cult led by her own parents that nearly consumed her. 

She married a physically and emotionally abusive woman with a hidden drug habit. She successfully climbed the corporate ladder–only to discover she worked for an organized crime family. 

And after being diagnosed with breast cancer, she finally realized that the changes she needed to make could only be achieved by exploding the life she had deliberately created...

episodes.title: In the Shadow of Armageddon ~ with Ex-Jehovah's Witness REBECCA WOODWARD
episodes.description:
For most young women with a creative bent, growing up as a Jehovah's Witness is not easy. Such was the case for Rebecca. Rules, patriarchy, and the ever-present threat of Armageddon seemed set to stifle any hopes for a career as a writer ...

REBECCA WOODWARD is a freelance journalist and essayist currently working on her first book -- a memoir about the trials and tribulations of growing up Witness. Her work has been published in The New York Times, Electric Literature, HuffPost, Paste and Brooklyn Magazine.

episodes.title: Escaping CTL: the Dream Analysis Cult ~ GERETTE BUGLION
episodes.description:
GERETTE BUGLION is an author and educator, offering cult education and recovery, having spent eighteen years in a New York-based therapy cult. 

Through dream analysis, astrology and retreat work, Gerette fell under the spell of the founder of CTL - the Center for Transformational Learning - until a series of disturbing events forced her to leave.

Her book, An Everyday Cult, is out now and is an account of how coercive groups are being forced to use increasingly subtle techniques in order to exert control over their members.

#cults #belief #astrology

episodes.title: From Mormon to Peacock Mormon ~ with BRAD HARKER
episodes.description:
BRAD HARKER is a founder of the Peacock Mormons – an activist group advocating for LGBT equality inside and outside the Mormon church. 

Brad recently appeared on Australia’s 'Compass' programme – a weekly news-documentary -- talking about growing up Mormon and then coming out of the closet ... and out of the church.

MARK from Talk Beliefs chats with Brad about the challenges growing up gay in a church that was anything but gay-friendly, and marrying twice (to women) before finding love with a man.

episodes.title: My Claim Against the 'Two By Twos' ~ LAURA CONTI
episodes.description:
LAURA CONTI returns to the show to speak about growing up fourth generation of a secretive Christian sect known as the Two By Twos. 

Laura got back in touch to alert people to the Redress Scheme of the Australian Royal Commission -- a scheme that investigates allegations of harm within groups like the Two By Twos, urging for acknowledgement and compensation. 

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks with Laura about the Redress Scheme and her own claim against the group.

ANKE RICHTER is an international journalist, foreign correspondent and author based in Christchurch. episodes.title: I Lost My Parents to QAnon ~ with COURTNEY HEARD
episodes.description:
COURTNEY HEARD is known as the ‘Godless Mom’ with a very popular website and podcast of the same name. Her current podcast, however, is ‘Q-dropped’ where she speaks to people whose friends and family have been sucked into the infamous Q-anon cult of recent years – a cult which began online with messages from the mysterious Q -- affecting  its followers’ political and religious outlooks. 

MARK talks to Courtney about QAnon's origins, evolution, and how her liberal, left-leaning parents got sucked into the cult and became totally different people.

episodes.title: Divorcing Religion - My Mennonite Journey. Interview with JANICE SELBIE.
subjects: The Church Of God In Christ

episodes.title: My Mennonite Journey ~ with JANICE SELBIE
episodes.description:
Imagine growing up Pentecostal and then leaving that world only to join the Mennonites. But for JANICE SELBIE, that is exactly what happened. 

Janice is a religious recovery consultant and founder of the Conference on Religious Trauma as well as Shameless Sexuality: Life After Purity Culture conference. As a registered professional counsellor personally acquainted with religious trauma syndrome (RTS), she can easily relate to her clients.

MARK from Talk Beliefs hears Janice's story of religious restrictions that led to even more stringent rules -- and even to flirtation with Eastern religions. When she finally realized that she was suffering from religious trauma syndrome, she set herself on a path to reason and recovery.

#belief #mennonite #religioustrauma

episodes.title: Who Were the Children of God? (EXCERPT)
episodes.description:
Excerpt from: Childhoods End - My Escape from the Children of God ~ with DANIELLA MESTYANEK YOUNG

For many people, the Children of God is one of the world's most shocking and infamous religious cults. Beginning in the counterculture era of the late 1960s, founder David Berg soon introduced sexual elements to his spiritual message, encouraging open sexual contact between all members of his flock - including between adults and children.

In the full version of this interview, author DANIELLA MESTYANEK YOUNG  with MARK from Talk Beliefs about growing up in the cult, performing in lewd videos as a youngster, and ultimately engineering her escape and joining the US Army. Free from the sect, she was shocked to find echoes of the cult within the military...


#belief #cults #religion

episodes.title: TARGET: MOON - The Moonies Vs Lone Wolves ~ with TEDDY HOSE
episodes.description:
In July of this year, former President of Japan, Shinzo Abe, was shot and killed at the hands of a man who had a grudge against the Unification Church - whose members are known as the Moonies.

TEDDY HOSE is a writer and artist who grew up in a family that was part of the Unification Church but today he speaks out against the Church.  

Teddy deconstructs not only the events surrounding the assassination of the former Japanese president, but the Unification Church itself - an organization that has splintered into a number of paranoid factions.

#belief #moonies #cults

episodes.title: The Last Days - Fighting Fear In The Jehovah's Witnesses ~ ALI MILLAR
episodes.description:
ALI MILLAR was thrust into the Jehovah's Witness world at a young age when her lost and lonely mother converted. From then on it was meetings, rules and door-knocking. It was only when she realized that her own child would have to endure the same tensions that she decided to leave.

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks to Ali about growing up JW, how the sect makes its money, and her new book The Last Days - all about growing up in one of the world's most expertly crafted cults.


#exjw #cults #belief

episodes.title: GURU DAYS - Loving & Leaving the Rajneesh Sect ~ NICOLA RANSON
episodes.description:
The third in a series on the Rajneesh Cult.

Writer and Trauma Therapist NICOLA RANSON joined the Rajneesh sect in the 1970s, hoping to make the world a better place. What she found was hypocrisy and scandal at the hands of the group's leader - the guru, Osho.

MARK from Talk Beliefs dives into the world of Osho and the commune in Oregon known as Rajneeshpuram, and how thousands of people from all over the world were convinced that wearing orange and gyrating daily would save the world.

#cults #belief #rajneesh

episodes.title: Devotee No More ~ Ex Hare Krishna JONATHAN REDMON
episodes.description:
JONATHAN REDMON grew up as part of a mixed-race family in Canada, encountering bullying and racism that led him down several dark paths. One path led him to the Hare Krishna movement - a group that took him in and encouraged him to stay on as an outreach member.

Over the years Jonathan -- now renamed Jagajivan Das - was exposed to islamophobia, homophobia and maltreatment of women within this apparently enlightened group. One day, he knew it was time to leave.

episodes.title: Children of the Guru - Loss of Identity within the Rajneesh Cult ~ with SAM JAHARA
episodes.description:
SAM JAHARA was caught up in the cult of Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh when she was only a child. Before she knew it, her parents had whisked her away from normality in Rio de Janiero to a life of communes and cult-speak. Worst of all, she -- like other children within the sect -- found her identity virtually erased by the all-encompassing ego of the Guru.

Sam is a psychotherapist, supervisor and executive coach working with individuals and organisations – as well as one of the founders of Brighton and Hove Psychotherapy. Her perspective comes from many years working as a psychotherapist and understanding your history from a psychological as well as emotional angle.

#cults #belief #rajneesh

episodes.title: Eternity, Interrupted ~ with Former Mormon RAE GROSS
episodes.description:
RAE GROSS is an associate marriage and family therapist working with clients who have experienced religious trauma and other issues. 

She is also co-host of the FoMo podcast, a show aimed at ex-Mormons as well as anyone who has survived a high-demand group. 

RAE grew up in the Mormon church - the second eldest of seven children. Despite throwing herself into the religion, something always felt off. Things began to collapse after an early marriage and impossible expectations led her to request her excommunication - much to the dismay of her parents...

#fomo #exmo #cults 

👉🏾👉🏻RAE GROSS is an associate marriage and family therapist (#131631) under the supervision of Pam Shaffer (LMFT #91321)

episodes.title: Shunned To Death ~ with ex-Jehovah's Witness MATTHEW MAULDIN
episodes.description:
MATTHEW MAULDIN grew up in the Jehovah's Witnesses - rising in the ranks to become an elder as well as a so-called 'Bethelite' (serving in one of the JW headquarters).

But his doubts about the organization soon led to his expulsion. Without any kind of support, he found himself in a depression and attempted to take his own life.

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks with Matt about his years growing up in the JW world, his devotion to the organization, and his final realization that the Witnesses are really only out for themselves.

#exjw #belief #cults

episodes.title: A Brief History of Incels ~ with Sociologist MICHAEL HALPIN
episodes.description:
Mike Halpin returns to Talk Beliefs to go into even more depth about so-called 'incels' - the involuntary celibates.
What is the history of the incel phenomenon? When did it start? Was Jack the Ripper an incel? And are there female incels?
This and much more.

MICHAEL HALPIN is an Assistant Professor in Sociology and social anthropology at Dalhousie University, Canada, and is currently studying the experiences of socially isolated men. He has published papers on Involuntarily Celibates– or Incels – a growing and occasionally deadly phenomenon that may be on the rise.

#incels #belief #sociology

01:55 What is an incel?
03:50 Nature or Nurture?
09:36 Was Jack the Ripper an incel?

episodes.description:
A special preview of the upcoming interview with blogger, speaker and writer HEMANT MEHTA. An atheist activist, Hemant grew up as part of the Jain religion - an ancient Indian faith that focusses on non-violence. 

What is Jainism all about and what was it like for the skeptical teenage Hemant to live under its rules? This small taster gives us some insight.

#jainism #belief #thefriendlyatheist

episodes.title: SINS OF THE FATHER - Losing My Dad to the Rajneesh Cult ~ with LILY DUNN
episodes.description:
What happens when you're only six years old and your Dad vanishes one night to follow a guru?

LILY DUNN grew up with a mostly absentee father - an addicted, narcissistic man who fell into the Rajneesh cult. The group encouraged him to think only of himself - and he lived up to that with gusto.

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks to Lily about her strange upbringing, her life flitting in and out of the orange-garbed sect, and how her father - as well as the sect - finally and spectacularly impoded. 

With her new book, Sins of My Father, Lily presents a stark and emotional memoir of a relationship with a father who might as well have been a ghost.


#cults #belief #rajneesh

02:24 Life before the cult.
09:03 Everything changes.
15:27 The Rajneesh sect.
31:14 The downward spiral.
39:40 Life lessons.

episodes.title: Footsteps To Freedom - Leaving Hasidic Judaism ~ with PESACH EISEN
episodes.description:
For PESACH EISEN, life within an insular, Hasidic jewish community was a continuous treadmill of ritual and repitition. From his Bar Mitzvah onwards, he struggled with desires to live up to expectations of perfection that collided with a desire to be free.

MARK from Talk Beliefs chats to Pesach about his early life, his years in a Yeshiva (high school) in Israel, and his drifting into rebellion. Once a pariah in his own community, he now strives daily to help others who have also walked away from orthodoxy .

#exjew #hasidic #belief

episodes.title: From Fear to Freedom - Escaping the Jehovah's Witnesses ~ RENEE PICKLES
episodes.description:
RENEE PICKLES is  a mathematics teacher in Sydney, Australia and co-creator of jw.support – an online resource for ex-Jehovah’s Witnesses – a group she grew up in and left at age 21.

Renee talks with MARK from Talk Beliefs about growing up a devout and enthusiastic JW, only to experience doubts in her teenage years. Family life was a mixture of devotion and fear - leading to a daring escape and expulsion from the group that had once nutured her.

#belief #exjw #cults

episodes.title: MLMs - The Mormon Connection ~ with ROBERTA BLEVINS
episodes.description:
ROBERTA BLEVINS is a former trainer with LuLaRoe – a Multi-Level Marketing company – and were one of the few who was successful.  Now she is an anti-MLM advocate, speaking out and warning others about the potential harm of companies like LuLaRoe and others, companies that are often described as controlling and even cult-like.

In this second part of a two-part interview, Roberta talks about the connection between religious beliefs and MLMs, and why Multi-level marketing companies are not much different than cults. We focus on Mormons and why so many MLMs appeal to the Latter Day Saint culture...


#mlm #lularich #cults

episodes.title: The Myth of Race ~ with Evolutionary Biologist DR JOSEPH GRAVES
episodes.description:
What is meant by 'race'? Are 'race' and 'ethnicity' the same thing? And - most importantly - what are the misconceptions surrounding the differences people see in individuals of this planet?

DR JOSEPH L. GRAVES is an evolutionary biologist and professor in the Department of Biology at North Carolina A & T  State University, as well as an author, having just released his latest book: Racism, Not Race: Answers to Frequently Asked Questions.

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks with Dr Graves about growing up racially sidelined in school, using evolutionary science to explore the science behind ethnicity, and why biological 'race' is a social construction rather than a scientific reality.

#ethnicity #belief #evolution

episodes.description:

episodes.title: Memoir of an Ex-Mormon Woman ~ HEIDI BAILEY
episodes.description:
What is life like for a modern Mormon woman? 

HEIDI BAILY grew up Mormon, the youngest of six children. From an early age she was taught that it is a girl's "divine nature" to "raise God's army". A woman is expected to marry a righteous man, have many children, and devote her life to serving her husband and children. College and a career are not encouraged. 

MARK from Talk Beliefs hears Heidi's story about questioning expectations, admonitions by Mormon leaders, and discovering she was part of the LGBT community - largedly frowned upon by the LDS church.

#belief #exmormon #women

episodes.title: GENERATION INCEL - Inside the Mind of the Involuntary Celibate ~ with Sociologist MICHAEL HALPIN
episodes.description:
They want a relationship ... but can't have one. So, they take to the incel forums. An 'incel ' (or Involuntary Celibate) is someone participating in a mostly online subculture populated by socially-isolated men. Characteried by degrading posts about women, these 'incels' can occasionally take things too far -- even murdering the objects of their hatred.

MICHAEL HALPIN is an Assistant Professor in Sociology and social anthropology at Dalhousie University, Canada. He and his colleagues have analyzed thousands of incel forum websites to better understand these communities.

MARK from Talk Beliefs dives deep into this weird and unsettling world, uncovering the habits, secret language and dark plans of so-called incels.

#incels #belief #sociology

01:31 Mike's background 
03:23 What is an ‘incel’? 
06:22 What do they talk about? 
16:31 Incel behavior
27:36 Elliot Rodger

episodes.description:
ROBERT BUCKLIN is a 27-year-old Patient Care Associate who is also heavily involved in bringing awareness to abuses within the Agapé Boarding School for Boys, a private Christian school located in Missouri – a school that he was sent to for most of his teenage years.

MARK from Talk Beliefs interviews Robert about his six years at Agapé, where the supposedly reformative school gave free reign to physical, mental, and sexual harm of its students.

episodes.title: SIGNING OFF - Saying Goodbye to the Westboro Baptist Church ~ ZACH PHELPS-ROPER
episodes.description:
They are known throughout the world - and for all the wrong reasons. The Westboro Baptist Church of Topeka, Kansas are unapologetically loud, brash and happy that God hates you.

ZACH PHELPS-ROPER grew up as the middle child of the founding Phelps family. His days were filled with fire-and-brimstone teaching from the church's patriarch, Fred Phelps, as well as the picketing of concerts and funerals. But Zach couldnt stay in the church any longer when his desire to be a doctor was given no respect at all.

MARK from Talk Beliefs digs into the world of Westboro and learns a few secrets straight from one of the Phelps family members - secrets that Zach reveals with candor and emotion.


#westborobaptistchurch #cults #belief


00:00 START
02:11 Westboro Overview
08:27 Growing Up Westboro
14:24 Fred Phelps
23:15 Leaving Westboro
39:02 Any Good Memories?

episodes.title: Childhoods End - My Escape from the Children of God ~ with DANIELLA MESTYANEK YOUNG
episodes.description:
For many people, the Children of God is one of the world's most shocking and infamous religious cults. Beginning in the counterculture era of the late 1960s, founder David Berg soon introduced sexual elements to his spiritual message, encouraging open sexual contact between all members of his flock - including between adults and children.

Author DANIELLA MESTYANEK YOUNG speaks with MARK from Talk Beliefs about growing up in the cult, performing in lewd videos as a youngster, and ultimately engineering her escape and joining the US Army. Free from the sect, she was shocked to find echoes of the cult within the military...

episodes.title: Blood On Their Hands: Ex Jehovah's Witness ASHER CANDOR
episodes.description:
ASHER CANDOR appeared recently on Vice's documentary 'Crusaders', focusing on traumatically losing his mother to the Jehovah's Witnesses strict opposition to blood transfusions. 

Here, Ash goes into even more detail about that experience, as well as growing up as an LGBT/transitioning person in the JW world.

MARK from Talk Beliefs catches up with Ash from his studio in San Antonio, Texas.


#exjw #belief #cult

episodes.title: Gaslighting in the C3 Evangelical Church ~ with EMILY PERRY
episodes.description:
EMILY PERRY runs the @c3churchwatch account on Instagram, exposing abuses within the C3 Church. 

Emily spent three years in C3 - most of it under "pastoral care" that was unwanted. It began while she was trying to alert the church pastors and get help when an abuser showed up at a church conference and was threatening towards her. 

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks with Emily about the C3 church, its reach across the world, its constant demands for donations and hollow promises of care and sympathy.

#evangelical #belief #cults

episodes.title: Flat-Smacked - Inside the Mind of a Flat-Earther ~ with ALEX OLSHANSKY
episodes.description:
What would make anyone think the earth is flat? What is at the core of the conspiracy mindset? ALEX OLSHANSKY, M.A., is a Doctoral Candidate in the College of Media and Communication at Texas Tech University. Alex  examines how people cognitively process science misinformation and conspiracy theories, with a special interest in Flat Earth conspiracies.

MARK from Talk Belief delves into Alex's amazing research, research which took him and his colleagues to Flat Earth conferences and to dedicated Flat Earthers themselves. But what is the psychology behind it all? What makes a Flat Earther tick?


#flatearth #conspiracy #belief


00:00 START
01:54 Alex's background
09:13 The research
14:04 Talking to Flat-Earthers
23:04 Emotional needs
30:01 The conspiracy mindset
36:03 Dealing with conspiracy theorists



LINKS FOR ALEX OLSHANSKY:

SITE: https://www.depts.ttu.edu/comc/faculty/faculty/aolshansky.php

CV: https://www.depts.ttu.edu/comc/faculty/vita/aolshansky-CV.pdf

TWITTER: @alexolshansky


RESEARCH PAPERS:

Landrum, A. R., Olshansky, A., & Richards, O. (2021). Differential susceptibility to misleading flat earth arguments on YouTube. Media Psychology, 24:1, 136-165, https://doi.org/10.1080/15213269.2019.1669461

Olshansky, A., Peaslee, R., & Landrum, A. R. (2020). Flat Smacked! Converting to Flat Eartherism. Journal of Media and Religion. https://doi.org/10.1080/15348423.2020.1774257

Landrum, A. R. & Olshansky, A. (2020). Third-person Perceptions and Calls for Censorship of Flat Earth Videos on YouTube. Media & Communication, 8(2), XX-XX. https://doi.org/10.17645/mac.v8i2.2853

Landrum, A. R., & Olshansky, A. (2019). The Role of Conspiracy Mentality in Denial of Science and Susceptibility to Viral Deception about Science. Politics and the Life Sciences, 38(2), 193-209. https://doi.org/10.1017/pls.2019.9

episodes.title: Cult Toons - How Christians Warned Their Youth Against Mormons & Jehovah's Witnesses
episodes.description:
Jeremiah Films was founded in 1978 and produced videos that "promote patriotism, traditional values, and a Biblical worldview."

'The God Makers' is a film highlighting the inner workings and perceived negative aspects of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (LDS Church). 

Jeremiah Films produced the film in 1982, expressing a highly critical view of the LDS Church, its practices, and its teachings. The film purports to be an exposé of the church's secrets, and features an animated segment outlining Mormon beliefs.

In 1986, Jeremiah films released 'Witnesses of Jehovah', a new documentary that included a new animation exposing JW's version of Christianity.

Both animations reveal accurate accounts of LDS & JW beliefs that existed at the time of their production.

But is this a case of the pot calling the kettle black? You be the judge.

01:09 Animation on Mormons

07:30 Animation on Jehovah's Witnesses

episodes.title: The Cold Comfort of the Seventh-day Adventist Church ~ with SHAWN KLAY
episodes.description:
SHAWN KLAY joined the Seventh-day Adventist church after meeting his wife. Training to be a pastor within the SDA church, he became disillusioned after the church sided with his wife - despite her bizarre behavior and violent acts.

MARK from Talk Beliefs catches up with Shawn as he tells his harrowing story, a story of betrayal, court cases, and what he refers to as 'cultural adventism'.

#belief #exadventist #skeptic

03:16 Doubts & red flags
08:47 Family stresses
14:25 A major incident
33:26 Advice

episodes.title: Acting Class Cults - Hollywood's Hidden Phenomenon ~ with ALICE GRECZYN
episodes.description:
ALICE GRECZYN an actor known for the films House of Fears and Dukes of Hazzard and also as "Mads" Rybak from the ABC family show, The Lying Game. She also grew up in a nomadic evangelical family – a story that she tells in her new book, Wayward.

MARK talks to Alice about 'acting class cults'. In Hollywood and other parts of the world, an acting class can sometimes be a place where a narcissistic acting coach rules supreme over his class, extracting personal information and using it against students at will. Alice talks about her experiences with this little-known phenomenon.

episodes.title: Exposing Enthusiastic Sobriety Programs ~ LIZ NICKERSON
episodes.description:
LIZ NICKERSON is founder of the support site, Enthusiastic Sobriety Abuse – a resource for those who have experienced abuse in Enthusiastic Sobriety Programs. In 2004, as a sixteen year old, she was sent to one of these facilities.

Today she campaigns and speaks out against these programs, programs that Liz now considers dangerous and cult-like.
 
MARK from Talk Beliefs hears Liz's story of her two years inside a Enthusiastic Sobriety facility, where prejudices, magical thinking, and bizarre judgments were the order of the day.

#enthusiasticsobriety #breakingcodesilence

episodes.title: DARING TO DOUBT - Kissing Purity Culture Goodbye ~ ALICE GRECZYN
episodes.description:
ALICE GRECZYN an actor known for the films House of Fears and Dukes of Hazzard and also as "Mads" Rybak from the ABC Family show, The Lying Game. She also grew up in a nomadic evangelical family – a story that she tells in her new book, Wayward.

MARK talks to Alice about growing up in a family that moved from place to place and school to school, all the while adhering to 'purity culture' ideals of total sexual chastity, choosing instead to wait for a nebulous future husband that had been supposedly chosen by God...

episodes.title: TABERNACLE OF HATE ~ with Former White Supremacist KERRY NOBLE
episodes.description:
In the 70s and 80s, KERRY NOBLE was ranking high in the Covenant, the Sword, and the Arm of the Lord - a far-right, militant organization dedicated to Christian Identity, white nationalism and survivalism.

On an attempt to leave an explosive device in a gay-friendly church, Kerry had a change of heart. His group were not so easy to turn around, leading to a tense standoff with the FBI. 

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks to Kerry about his incredible story, a tale of racism, polygamy and an undying belief that God was on their side...


#lifeafterhate

Arkansas drone footage by This Road Trip Life

episodes.title: DISMANTLED – Moonie No More ~ with JEN KIABA
episodes.description:
Jen Kiaba grew up as a 'moonie' - a member of the Unification Church, whose founder, Reverend Moon, claimed to be greater than Jesus.

Early years meant hard labor, street proselytizing, and keeping unauthorized boyfriends secret. But it was when she was tricked into a marriage ceremony that her descent into doubt began...

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks to Jen from her home in New York. 

👉🏻👉🏿Illustrated throughout with photos from Jen's days in the church as well as her own artistic photography

*

JEN KIABA is a photo-based artist as well as an educator. Throughout this interview we will view her expressionist photographic art, art which reveals a suffocating, haunted past.

*

Music by Chris Zabriskie


#exmoonie #belief #cults

episodes.title: Escaping the Kerala Brethren ~ with KEETU of Keetu's Diary
episodes.description:
**Note - some images have had to be retroactively blurred for privacy.

You may have heard of the Exclusive Brethren, but who are the Kerala Brethren?

Keetu grew up in India and found herself in a Christian sect known as the Kerala Brethren and a congregation located in Saudi Arabia. After initial care, love and freedom, the restrictions started to tighten. 

MARK from Talk Beliefs links up with Keetu from her home in Newfoundland. She takes us on a journey from endurance to breaking point - resulting in her escape to Canada and new life as a successful vlogger.

episodes.title: Secrets of the Heaven's Gate Cult ~ with DR JANJA LALICH
episodes.description:
In 1997, thirty-nine members of the Heaven's Gate UFO cult took their own lives -- believing that their astral bodies would join with a UFO trailing the Hale-Bopp comet.

JANJA LALICH has studied and written about cults for thirty years, appearing in many documentaries on cultic groups and cult leaders. MARK from Talk Beliefs welcomes Janja back to the channel to talk about her own involvement in the Heaven's Gate incident, and reveals details not heard in the recent HBO Max documentary, Heaven's Gate The Cult of Cults.

#heavensgate #cults #ufo

episodes.title: Examining the 'War on Christmas' ~ ALISTAIR LICHTEN of the National Secular Society
episodes.description:
Is there REALLY a 'War on Christmas'?

ALISTAIR LICHTEN is the head of education of the National Secular Society in the United Kingdom. His Masters Degree thesis focused on the apparent persecution complex of Christian Right as well as the so-called 'War on Christmas'. Do some Christians really think that the secular world is trying to totally expunge the Christ story, Nativity, and angel on top of the Christmas tree?

In this special Christmas (or should that be 'Winterville'?) episode, MARK from Talk Beliefs chats with Alistair about faith schools, the Christian persecution complex and where it might stem from, and replacing the Baby Jesus with sausage rolls!

#waronchristmas #christmas #belief

episodes.description:
Cure for Hate (Part 2 of 2)

TONY MCALEER is an international speaker & co-founder of Life After Hate, an organization which helps those who wish to leave hate groups.

Tony spent his youth as part of the White Aryan Resistance (WAR) - a white supremacist neo-Nazi organization founded by a KKK member.

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks to Tony about growing up in the UK, early influences, and how he came to join the White Aryan Resistance in Canada. 

What is behind these feelings of hate and in the end, what causes one to leave? Find all this out and more in this final part.

#belief #cults #exwhitesupremacist

episodes.title: Brethren Born ~  DR JILL AEBI-MYTTON - Ex-Exclusive Brethren
episodes.description:
Ex Cult Member and Chartered Counselling Psychologist Dr Jill Aebi-Mytton was born into the Exclusive Brethren and left when her parents did in 1960.
 
Jill offers voluntary work for former members of cultic groups and also gives support to those going through litigious actions by the Plymouth (Exclusive) Brethren.

Jill is also currently setting up new research with the University of Salford, based up an in-depth study of the Brethren and effects on members' psychology.

MARK from Talk Beliefs chats with Jill about her upbringing,  inside information about the Brethren, and how she now counsels ex cult members who have been through similar stresses and strains to what she has experienced.

#cults #exclusivebrethren #belief

episodes.title: How NXIVM Draws In Its Members ~ with RACHEL BERNSTEIN (consultant, 'Seduced')
episodes.description:
RACHEL BERNSTEIN  has worked with victims of cults and emotional abusers for 27 years and was trained in Structural Family Therapy, Humanistic Therapy, Psychodynamic, and Existential Therapy.

MARK from Talk Beliefs interviews Rachel again, this time focusing on NXIVM - the cult that seduced several women into a slave-master secret society that required painful branding of the skin.

How do cults like NXIVM draw in its members? Why would anyone fall for such an obvious deception? Rachel reveals exactly why all of us are more susceptible to manipulation than we may think...

episodes.title: Why I Left Christianity ~ with HANNAH TIMSON
episodes.description:
HANNAH TIMSON grew up Christian and even appeared as a representative of Christianity on the 2011 reality show, Living with the Amish. The show proved to be the catalyst for her deconversion, leading to many questions and doubts about the Bible and belief in general.

Hannah became President of Humanist Students, the student section of Humanists UK and has appeared on the the popular Christian show 'Unbelievable?' several times discussing her atheism.

MARK from Talk Beliefs catches up with Hannah from her home in Devon, UK to talk growing up religious, problems with the Bible, Humanism ... and living with the Amish!

30:19 HEAR HANNAH SING 'EDELWEISS'


 #belief #exchristian #humanist

Topsham & Exeter Quay (Devon, England) | Cinematic Drone Footage (4K) | DJI Mavic Air 2 by Mat Perry

episodes.title: 'Music Saved Me' ~ Interview with Ex-Jehovah's Witness WESLEY DAVID
episodes.description:
Musician WESLEY DAVID grew up Jehovah's Witness in New Jersey. Through constant church meetings, expectations of purity, and threat of Armageddon, Wes clung to his love of music to get him through - eventually leaving the group and penning his first album.

MARK from Talk Beliefs chats to Wesley about growing up JW, his love of music, and what conclusions he has come to on the Bible-believing group that he now deems to be a cult...

#exjw #cults #belief

episodes.title: Paris Hilton & YouTube Army Expose 'Circle of Hope' ~ with AMANDA HOUSEHOLDER
episodes.description:
AMANDA HOUSEHOLDER grew up in several religious boarding schools run by her parents. These institutions were ruled with an iron fist and she witnessed first-hand physical, mental and sexual mistreatment on a daily basis.

Amanda's campaigns against Circle of Hope has now resulted the removal of girls from the ranch. Her story has been featured on many top news platforms, including NBC. Paris Hilton, herself a survivor of an abusive school, has contacted Amanda to pledge her help.

MARK from Talk Beliefs reunites with Amanda to hear all the details about the amazing response to her continued activism.

#troubledteenindustry #piecesofvictory

Incidental music by the indomitable Chris Zabriskie: http://chriszabriskie.com

episodes.title: Is It Time for Christians to Accept Evolution? ~ with PROFESSOR DENIS LAMOUREUX
episodes.description:
(RE-UPLOAD WITH IMPROVED SOUND)

Is it time for Christians - and theists in general - to accept evolution?

DENIS LAMOUREUX is a full Professor of Science & Religion and  a research associate in Paleontology at St. Joseph's College in the University of Alberta. He holds both a PhD in Evangelical Theology as well as a PhD in Evolutionary Biology. He writes, lectures and debates on the subject of the acceptance of evolution as face within a Biblical framework.

MARK from Talk Beliefs chats to Denis about growing up creationist, his realization that evolution is a fact, and how he has reconciled the two. 

#evolution #creation #belief

episodes.title: An Atheist Reviews the Christian 'Alpha Course' ~ with MATTHEW TAYLOR
episodes.description:
What happens when an atheist joins the Christian 'Alpha Course'?

MATTHEW TAYLOR grew up in Zambia to missionary parents, eventually rejecting Christianity and becoming an atheist. He is the co-host of the 'Still Unbelievable' and 'Proscenium' podcasts. He writes about his Christian upbringing in Confessions of a Young Earth Creationist.

MARK from Talk Beliefs chats with Matthew about the origins of the Alpha Course, why it has been so successful, and what he personally thought of how this course was presented. Were there good arguments for God? Were the apologetics strong and thought-provoking? Or are those behind Alpha not concerned about apologetics at all?

01:01 Intro Matthew
01:49 Growing up Missionary
12:08 Origins of the Alpha Course
16:03 Matt's Alpha Experience
29:51 What is the success/dropout rate of Alpha?
43:37 What were your conclusions about the course?

episodes.description:

episodes.title: To the Moon and Back ~ Interview with LISA KOHN, ex-Unification Church
episodes.description:
LISA KOHN spent her early years in the Unification Church in New York. As a Moonie, she and her mother and brother rubbed shoulders with the 'sinless' children of the Messiah, witnessed mass weddings and followed the Divine Principle. 

After living two lives - one with her hippie father and the other with her Moonie mother - Lisa left the Church and came to terms with having been in a cult. 

Her book, 'To The Moon and Back', is a fascinating & frank memoir of her childhood & teen years in the Unification Church. MARK from Talk Beliefs chats to her about her life, her book and secrets of the Moon holy family she learned at close quarters...

#exmoonie #cults #belief

episodes.title: What Makes a Conspiracy Theorist? ~ with MATT BERKOWITZ of the Science Literacy Channel
episodes.description:
Moon Landing. JFK. Flat Earth. Can we get into the mind of a conspiracy theorist? 

MATT BERKOWITZ is a statistician currently working on his PhD at Simon Fraser University  in Vancouver. He is the writer & presenter of the Science Literacy YouTube Channel.

In this interview, Matt deconstructs the conspiracy mindset, peeling away layers to look at denialism, cognitive biases, and emotional needs that may lead an otherwise perfectly rational person down the path of irrational thinking.

#conspiracies #denialism #biases

episodes.description:
(Re-recording): AMANDA HOUSEHOLDER grew up in several religious boarding schools run by her parents. These institutions were ruled with an iron fist and she witnessed first-hand physical, mental and sexual mistreatment on a daily basis.

episodes.title: JWs & the Social Distancing of Shunning - with Criminologist JULIA GUTGSELL
episodes.description:
JULIA GUTGSELL (BSc, MSc) is a criminologist whose dissertation on the impact of shunning in the Jehovah's Witnesses was awarded with the Jeanine Segers prize for original and innovative research.

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks with Julia about her first encounter with Jehovah's Witnesses which led to a lifelong fascination with the group, as well as her findings on the psychology of shunning in high-control groups such as the JWs.

episodes.title: Modern Church... Modern Slavery? The C3 Church Pentecostal Cult ~ Richard Turner
episodes.description:
What happens when a group set up to help victims of human trafficking is just as controlling of its own members? 

RICHARD TURNER grew up near Liverpool, UK, and trained as a therapist before finding a placement within a charity linked to a church - a church that quickly seduced him into their ranks. Before long, they were watching his every move, even demanding that he not see his girlfriend, but rather 'submit to the leadership of the church'.

MARK from Talk Beliefs interviews Richard about his story of his time with this church and how, after suffering serious stress, he was eventually able to leave.

#cults #beliefs #pentecostal

episodes.title: Why I Left the Transcendental Meditation Movement ~ ex TM teacher PATRICK RYAN
episodes.description:
At age 17, Patrick Ryan joined the Transcendental Meditation ('TM') movement, following the teachings of master Maharishi. He rose through the ranks, promoting and teaching TM - which included highly-secretive courses on how to levitate and become invisible.

Patrick became disillusioned with his life in TM when he began to see inconsistencies and lies within the sect. Now he speaks out and helps others who have been inside - or who are still inside - cults.

MARK from Talk Beliefs continues his interview with Patrick, hearing the fascinating and often highly-bizarre tale of exiting the group and beginning a new life.

#transcendentalmeditation #cults #TM


WATCH PART ONE: Why I Joined the Transcendental Meditation Movement ~ ex TM teacher PATRICK RYAN: http://bit.ly/395Uiop


PATRICK RYAN is the founder and former head of TM-EX, the organization of ex-members of Transcendental Meditation.  He established ICSA’s online resource (1995-2013), was the editor of AFF News, a news publication for former cult members (1995-1998),is co-author of “Ethical Standards for Thought Reform Consultants,” and writes for the CULTS101 newsletter.

episodes.title: Mormons & Evolution ~ with Jon Perry of Stated Clearly
episodes.description:
MARK from Talk Beliefs chats informally to JON PERRY of the Stated Clearly YouTube channel. They discuss Jon's growing up Mormon, how he lost his faith, and how Mormons view science and evolution.

Stated Clearly is a popular science-based YouTube channel that offers up highly watchable animations that explain evolution, DNA, and science in general. The Stated Clearly animations have been used in schools and lectures, and have spawned a sister channel, Stated Casually.

(This video is taken from an initial online chat where Mark and Jon discussed a future interview which would involve his Mormon brother, Mike. Link to the finished interview below.)

episodes.title: Losing My Religion in the International Churches of Christ (ICOC) ~ Helen Harris
episodes.description:
HELEN HARRIS joined the International Churches of Christ (ICOC) when she was 18. Not long after attaining a leadership role, she began to recognize the church as a high-control group.

Here, in a fully-illustrated interview, she speaks to MARK from Talk Beliefs about her time in the ICOC, the warning signs that caused her to doubt, and why it was not an easy thing to leave...

#icoc #cults #religions

episodes.title: What Is SHINTOISM?
episodes.description:
A short overview of Shintoism - the religion of the kami. Most prevalent in Japan, the followers of Shinto believe that all things contain spirit and that these spirits must be revered.

There are thousands of Shinto shrines in Japan and every day people visit them to pay respects to the spirits and to hang good fortune papers which they hope the spirits will see...

#japan #shinto #religion

episodes.description:
Debutante INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN: http://debutante.kamiladydyna.com/wp/

KAMILA DYDYNA is a Dublin-based filmmaker who grew up as a Jehovah's Witness in Poland. Having left the religion, she has created a powerful drama script entitled 'Debutante' - about the experiences of one JW girl who is brought before her church's strict Judicial Committee.

MARK from Talk Beliefs goes in depth with Kamila about her early days as a JW, her films, and why Debutante is a very important story to tell in today's world.

episodes.title: Shocking Secrets from the NXIVM Trial - Beyond 'The Vow' ~ with Dr Janja Lalich.
episodes.description:
* Some viewers may find some of this content upsetting.

The NXIVM group was a front for a cult that branded women like cattle and treated them like objects, and yet its members were enthralled by its leader.

Hollywood stars such as Smallville's Allison Mack counted themselves as disciples. The current HBO documentary The Vow tells the entire story of Raniere's rise.

In March 2018, the cult's leader Keith Raniere was arrested and indicted on a variety of charges. His federal trial began on May 7, 2019.  

DR JANJA LALICH is a well-known researcher, author, educator, and professor emerita of Sociology at California State University, Chico. She has studied and taught about the subject of cults for more than 30 years and has appeared on countless documentaries and podcasts.

She talks with MARK from Talk Beliefs about her role as an observer at the Raniere trial - and everything that was revealed about the cult leader and his odious ways.

#cults #nxivm #thevow

01:58 Dr Lalich talks about her life in a cult.
05:28 What exactly is NXIVM?
10:34 Dr Lalich explains why she was invited to the trial.
13:35 Highlights of the trial.
30:13 Dr Lalich talks about staying with former NXIVM members.
33:02 What type of people join cults?
37:13 Upcoming agenda for Dr Lalich.

episodes.title: What Is Black Dog Lore? ~ with ethnocynologist David Ian Howe
episodes.description:
DAVID IAN HOWE is an 'ethnocynologist' whose specialty is the study of dogs and wolves within human cultural contexts. He is also an archaeologist who has uncovered hundreds of ancient tribal dog burials in the United States. @davidianhowe

David has contributed to TedEd and is a co-host of the popular  'A Life In Ruins' archaeology podcast. He also runs the @ethnocynology instagram feed.

MARK from Talk Beliefs catches up with David for a second fully-illustrated interview - this time to explore the weird world of 'black dog' folklore. Do ghost dogs and hell hounds really exist? Just imaginative folklore? And what about werewolves?

A fun discussion just in time for Halloween!


HIGHLIGHTS FROM THIS INTERVIEW:

02:07 Black Dog Lore

11:44 Cerebus the Three-Headed Dog

13:46 Ancient Dog Burials

17:41 Origins of Werewolves

#dogs #halloween #wolf

episodes.title: Ex Seventh-Day Adventist Nellie Smith ~ Fear & Loathing in the SDA Church
episodes.description:
NELLIE SMITH (née McLennan) grew up Seventh Day Adventist in Australia. Here, in a fully illustrated interview, she explains the fear she remembers as a child - fear of an imminent End of the World, fear of not living up to an ideal of perfection, and fear of not keeping the Sabbath (Saturday, for Adventists).

MARK from Talk Beliefs catches up with Nellie from her home in Mittagong, New South Wales.

01:00 Nellie's young life in SDA.

04:43 Origins of the Seventh-day Adventist Church.

12:48 Similarity to Jehovah's Witnesses and constant fear.

17:26 When did you decide you'd had enough?

20:58 Abraham Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs (diagram).

21:34 Advice to those still in the SDA...?


Special thanks to Peter Veitch for his help in the organizing of this interview. 

#talkbeliefs #exsda #seventhdayadventist

episodes.title: Coming Out Gay at 'Project Patch' ~ with Coleman McNear
episodes.description:
* Some viewers may find some of this content disturbing.

The 'troubled teen industry' is big business, and many are run by religious groups whose goal is to take a 'broken' teen and turn him or her into a model Christian.

COLEMAN MCNEAR was sent to Project Patch for eighteen months by her father - a Seventh Day Adventist facility in Idaho. Awaiting her there were suffocating rules, harsh punishments (including 'takedowns' and being sent out into the wilderness on 'Phase') and an expectation to conform to Biblical principles. 

But what happens when the staff discover you are gay?

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks in-depth with Coleman about her time in Project Patch, what she discovered while there, and warnings for others. Illustrated with photos & video.

#troubledteens #beliefs #projectpatch

episodes.title: The Cult of Multi-Level Marketing Schemes (MLMs)? ~ with Alexandra Stein
episodes.description:
Selling products from home - a cult? Is it possible that Multi-Level Marketing schemes selling products such as make-up, vitamins, cleaning products, etc, could actually be alarmingly similar in structure to a religious cult?

ALEXANDRA STEIN, Ph.D, is a writer and educator specializing in the social psychology of cults and other dangerous social relationships.

MARK from TalkBeliefs chats with Alexandra on MLMs, how they work and why the way they are organized are frighteningly similar to the coercive structure of cults.

episodes.description:
Over five days of the last month of the Islamic lunar calendar, every Muslim who is able is required to make a pilgrimage to the Ka’bah. But what is this mysterious cube-shaped edifice, and what is its significance for Muslims?

This short overview let's the casual viewer in on the holy pilgrimage known as the 'Hajj' - and the mysterious black stone deliberately embedded in the Ka'bah's eastern corner.

episodes.title: The Exclusive Brethren - Justice, Harm & Awareness ~ with Jacky Hart
episodes.description:
JACKY HART (ex-Exclusive Brethren) presents a new and updated talk - fully illustrated -  on the isolationist Christian sect known as the Exclusive Brethren.

The Exclusive Brethren (recently re-branded as the Plymouth Brethren Christian Church or PBCC) is a sect of Protestantism that practices isolation from the world, even going as far as avoiding eating with non-Brethren. 

Jacky outlines how the sect promised to abide by the rules of the Charity Commission and not has followed through. Also, how a documentary team was threatened by the Brethren until a segment about them was pulled...


#exbrethren #exclusivebrethren #cult #plymouthbrethren



00:00 START

13:40 How the Brethren responded to the Cults, Taboos & Twisted Faith documentary.

23:00 Short Q&A

episodes.title: Cults & Coercive Control ~ with Matthew Remski & Dr Alexandra Stein
episodes.description:
* Some viewers may find some of this content disturbing.

On April 3, 2019 The Family Survival Trust presented a conversation between Matthew Remski, author of the new book, Practice and All Is Coming, and cult expert & author Dr. Alexandra Stein.

Here, Matthew and Alexandra discuss cultic coercive control as it exists in certain yoga communities, as well as discussing broader questions about cults and brainwashing. 

[Apologies for variable lighting in this venue]

Matthew Remski is a yoga cult survivor and now writes and presents on yoga and ayurveda in the shadows of capitalism and climate change. 

Alexandra Stein, Ph.D, is a writer and educator specializing in the social psychology of ideological intolerance and other dangerous social relationships.

For the Q&A section of this talk, go to: Yoga, Cults and Control ~ with Matthew Remski & Alexandra Stein http://bit.ly/2Xah5ZZ

episodes.title: Why I Left the International Churches of Christ (ICOC) ~ STACEY AVIVA FLINT
episodes.description:
Interview with STACEY AVIVA FLINT on her time within the International Churches of Christ (ICOC). 

Joining at age 16, she quickly became a top recruiter, encouraged to bring celebrities and business people into the group. At first a new family for her, the Church quickly became controlling - their dictates extending even to her relationships and children.  

Here, Stacey reveals her story of how she came to realize that she had been lured into a cult...

episodes.title: Teaching Evolution in the Bible Belt ~ Archaeologist Ella Beaudoin
episodes.description:
ELLA BEAUDOIN works at the Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History in Washington, D.C. (specifically the Human Origins program), where she works to help and engage and teach the public on evolution and archaeology.

Her current project is to teach the facts of evolution to school children in Alabama - a largely conservative, Christian state - in a way which is sensitive to their deeply-held religious beliefs.

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks with Ella about the challenges of presenting evolution in a place where it is often seen as not only incorrect - but immoral.


**Want to hear more from Ella? Head on over to Evolution Soup YouTube Channel! https://youtu.be/WbjHaHQ5pzE

episodes.title: Alex O’Connor on Christian Apologist Frank Turek ~ Talk Beliefs Bytes
episodes.description:

episodes.title: Ghost Dancers & Star People - the Beliefs and Rituals of the Pawnee ~ with Carlton Gover.
episodes.description:
Photo-illustrated interview with Carlton Shield Chief Gover on North American tribal beliefs and how the Pawnee people differ from many other tribes. MARK from Talk Beliefs chats with Carlton about the beliefs of these fascinating people.

Why are the Pawnee different? Unusually, their beliefs are monotheistic and star-based, unlike most North American tribes whose religions are polytheistic and earth-based. And how did they react to the  European Christianisation of their lands?

CARLTON GOVER is a Doctorate Student & Archaeologist at University of Colorado Boulder and studies at University of Colorado, Boulder. He is Pawnee on his father's side and a member of the Pawnee Nation of Oklahoma. He is one of the hosts of the new A Life In Ruins archaeology podcast.

episodes.title: The Exclusive Brethren - Update 2019 with Jacky Hart ~ Talk Beliefs News
episodes.description:
Talk Beliefs News - Photo-Illustrated Audio YouTube Podcast for April 5th, 2019. Exclusive Brethren Update!

JACKY HART (ex-Exclusive Brethren) reunites with MARK from Talk Beliefs and NEAL from Reason Now for a new update on the Exclusive Brethren, the documentary about them that they tried to stop, and how one ex-member's fight against the Brethren has resulted in legal action.

The Exclusive Brethren (recently re-branded as the Plymouth Brethren) is a sect of Protestantism that practices 'exclusion from evil', that is, isolation from the world, even going as far as avoiding eating with non-brethren. 

Many who grow up in the sect are dissatisfied with this restrictive life and endeavor to leave, but family and doctrinal ties make leaving extremely difficult. There are often harsh punishments for those who do not tow the Brethren line...

#plymouthbrethren #exclusivebrethren #cults


LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

Jacky Hart: My Escape from the Exclusive Brethren - A Talk & Presentation ~ Jacky Hart http://bit.ly/2toPW8l

episodes.title: How Mormon 'Worthiness Interviews' Shames Children ~ with activist Sam Young [Explicit references]
episodes.description:
The Mormon Church is known for some unusual practices, but not many know about so-called 'worthiness interviews' that children and youths are expected to attend... 

In these interviews, Mormon leaders - bishops - have one-on-one interviews behind closed doors with young people from the congregation, asking them personal questions - including questions of a sexual nature.

SAM YOUNG grew up in the LDS (Mormon) church but was eventually excommunicated for speaking out about these interviews. Today he continues to campaign to change the program and programs like this. 

MARK from Talk Beliefs catches up with Sam to hear the entire story. 

***Please be aware that there are sexual references in this interview which may not be suitable for some viewers.***

#mormon #lds #protectldskids

episodes.title: Dogs & Wolves - Ancient Origins and Strange Beliefs ~ with David Ian Howe
episodes.description:
Dogs & Wolves - Origins and Beliefs - fully illustrated interview with David Ian Howe.

DAVID IAN HOWE is an 'ethnocynologist' whose specialty is the study of dogs and wolves within human cultural contexts. He is also an archaeologist who has uncovered hundreds of ancient tribal dog burials in the United States. 

MARK from Talk Beliefs digs deep with David into a world that few have seen and uncovers the myths, beliefs and also the evolutionary science behind the fascinating worlds of Man's Best Friend...

episodes.title: Cults and Extreme Beliefs ~ with Teddy Hose (ex Moonie)
episodes.description:
Photo-illustrated interview with TEDDY HOSE, a former member of the Unification Church (the 'Moonies'), known for its unusual practices including stadium-filled mass weddings. 

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks with Teddy about cults, the criteria that make up a cult, and how his years within the Moonies helped him to see patterns within other high-demand groups.

Teddy is an artist, humorist and contributor for The Huffington Post, The Bold Italic and McSweeney's. In 2018 he appeared on the A&E documentary series, Cults & Extreme Belief. 

#moonies #exmoonie #atheist

episodes.title: The London Protest - Jehovah's Witnesses REACT [EXTENDED VERSION]
episodes.description:
* Some viewers may find some of this content disturbing.

[PART ONE OF TWO] On Saturday, August 11th, 2018, the first of four protests against the policies of the Jehovah's Witnesses organization took place in London at the ExCel Convention Center.

With what turned out to be one of the biggest protests against JW.org of its kind, ex-members and others carried signs, banners, and illustrations of how the religion - deemed by many as a cult - has harmed and disenfranchised them through cruel doctrines. These include doctrines that protect those who would harm children and prohibit life-saving blood transfusions.

MARK from Talk Beliefs along with MEG from the Meg Slaymaker YouTube channel document this first day of protest, talking to protesters, Jehovah's Witnesses, and the public.

This version has some small extensions and fixes to the previous version available elsewhere on Talk Beliefs.

**As of March 2019, a change has been made to the Jehovah's Witness' elders handbook regarding the Two Witness Rule in regards to sexual abuse. A second witness is no longer necessary, however the branch office must be called. Although it is still not advised to call the police this is the first time that the Two Witness Rule has bowed to pressure to change.

PART TWO: http://bit.ly/2EZ8m6G

episodes.title: Finally Awake ~ Interview with Lydia Finch - Ex Jehovah's Witness
episodes.description:
Twenty years ago Lydia Finch was expelled ('disfellowshipped') from the Jehovah's Witnesses for dating a boy outside the faith. To this day, close family members will not speak to her, as is decreed by JW practices. 

Today, Lydia helps others who are struggling with their lives after leaving the Witnesses. She chats to Talk Beliefs about her harrowing story with great candor and detail about a life now a world away.

**This video originally appeared on Talk Beliefs in early 2017. This version has had an audio cleanup, plus images added to enhance Lydia's story. 

Special thanks to audio engineer Ian (aka 'looknowsee') for his cleanup of this audio: http://bit.ly/2wb2PFo

00:47 What was it like growing up Jehovah's Witness? 
04:11 What was the most difficult thing about growing up witness?
09:07 How has being 'disfellowshipped' affected you? 
19:25 Talk about the 'Two Witness Rule'

episodes.title: Atheist Twin/Mormon Twin - Jon Perry (of Stated Clearly) & Mike Perry
episodes.description:
What happens when you grow up as a twin within a Mormon household and then lose your faith? JON PERRY of the Stated Clearly YouTube Channel chats to MARK from Talk Beliefs about growing up Mormon and losing his faith. Joining us are Jon's twin brother MIKE PERRY - who has retained his faith in the LDS (Mormon) church. 

What happened to keep one twin in the faith and the other to lose faith? In this fascinating interview we dig deep to find out.

episodes.title: Are the Bible's Jesus Accounts Deliberate Myths? ~ with Mike Lawrence
episodes.description:
Talk Beliefs Bytes presents an excerpt from an interview with author, researcher and mythicist MIKE LAWRENCE on the accounts of Jesus found in the New Testament of the Bible. When looked at in the order they were written, do they seem to reveal an increasing amount of embellishment, or, indeed, outright mythmaking? Short clip from Mike's recent interview with Talk Beliefs on the reliability of the Apostle Paul.

ORIGINAL VIDEO: Can We Trust the Apostle Paul's Accounts of Jesus? ~ with Mike Lawrence http://bit.ly/2GVKYtX

Mike Lawrence is an author and secular activist who has campaigned against the religious indoctrination of children in schools and is the author of Astonishing Credulity, now in its 3rd edition. Mike currently resides in Hertfordshire, England.

episodes.title: Twice Shunned - Keion Cannon, ex-Jehovah's Witness
episodes.description:
MARK from Talk Beliefs interviews KEION CANNON - ex-Jehovah's Witness. Keion lives in Texas and became a part of the JW faith when his mother began Bible study with the Witnesses. However, his own critical thinking led him quickly to see cracks in the system. Keion was disfellowshipped not once, but twice...

***Apologies for poor Hangouts signal on my side of the conversation, but thankfully Keion came through loud and clear! :-)

#exjw #cults #beliefs

Questioning JW or Ex-JW? Like to talk to Keion? Email him at: keionc121@gmail.com

episodes.title: The Occult Origins of Scientology - Chris Shelton (excerpt) ~ Talk Beliefs Bytes
episodes.description:
Talk Beliefs Bytes presents an excerpt from 'Going Critical - Interview with Chris Shelton, ex-Scientologist'. In this excerpt, Chris talks about L Ron Hubbard, Aleister Crowley and how the occult influenced the beginnings of the Church of Scientology.

Chris is known for his very successful YouTube channel where he has hundreds of videos about Scientology and critical thinking. He also hosts the Sensibly Speaking podcast.

Chris has also appeared on the hit A&E television show, Scientology and the Aftermath, with Leah Remini and Mike Rinder.

episodes.title: Escape from the Exclusive Brethren - Interview with Jacky Hart
episodes.description:
Jacky Hart grew up as a part of the isolationist Protestant sect, the Exclusive Brethren (recently re-branded the 'Plymouth Brethren')  - regarded by some as a cult in similar vein to the Jehovah's Witnesses. At age 18, she left the group.

She tells an emotional story of how she was scrutinized, restricted, and indoctrinated by an organization that shuns the outside world and frowns upon members who no longer want to live within their walls.

Now Jacky works in conjunction with wikipeebia.com to help ex-Exclusive Brethren as well as those within the Exclusive Brethren who feel disaffected and wish to leave.

[REMASTERED & REUPLOADED VERSION OF AN ORIGINAL 2016 INTERVIEW.]

Special thanks to audio engineer Ian (aka 'looknowsee') for his cleanup of this audio: http://bit.ly/2wb2PFo

My Escape from the Exclusive Brethren - A Talk & Presentation ~ Jacky Hart http://bit.ly/2SPZNPE

Support site & information about the Brethren:
http://wikipeebia.com 
Email wikipeebia at supportnetwork@wikipeebia.com if you think you can help or need help.

The Brethren's own official website:
http://www.plymouthbrethrenchristianc...

Thank you to Neal Emery of Reason Coffee Shop & Bookstore for his kind permission to use the premises for this interview
http://bit.ly/2aeBhGw

episodes.description:

Talk Beliefs Bytes presents an excerpt from 'The Children of Cults - Dr. Janja Lalich - Special London Talk, June 2018'.

episodes.title: The Five Worst Things about the Jehovah's Witnesses ~ Talk By Ex-JW Meg Slaymaker
episodes.description:
Ex-Jehovah's Witness MEG SLAYMAKER gives a talk and presentation to the Society of Edmonton Atheists on Jehovah's Witness doctrine and policies, highlighting what she considers the be the 'five most horrible things' about the organization. These include child molestation & cover-ups, poor treatment of women, and disdain of higher education. 

Recorded at  Edmonton Public Library - Edmonton, Alberta, Canada, on Tuesday, December 14th, 2018.

NOTE - VARIABLE SOUND AND IMAGE ON THIS VIDEO. (This talk was recorded on phone by a member of the audience and then sent to Talk Beliefs. It has been cropped and cleaned up as much as possible, but the content was just too good to let this pass!)

Special thanks to audio engineer Ian (aka 'looknowsee') for his cleanup of this audio: http://bit.ly/2wb2PFo

episodes.title: Is There Evidence for Jesus Outside the Bible?  ~ Talk Beliefs Bytes
episodes.description:
Talk Beliefs Bytes presents an excerpt from 'Is This Proof Jesus Did Not Exist?' with author and mythicist Mike Lawrence. Here, Mike discusses the alleged corroborative sources that exist outside the bible, and how they may not offer up any evidence to the claims within the New Testament.

episodes.title: Cults in America ~ Interview with Rachel Bernstein
episodes.description:
Photo-illustrated interview with therapist and podcast host RACHEL BERNSTEIN. Rachel has been working with victims of cults and emotional abusers for 28 years. 

MARK from Talk Beliefs catches up with Rachel from her office in L.A., to talk about the DNA of cults, Scientology, 'cult interventions', and bizarre encounters with cult leaders [timestamp 23:03]

Rachel produces the IndoctriNation podcast with Jonathan Daniel Brown. On the weekly podcast she has interviewed ex-members of the Church of Scientology, Jehovah's Witnesses, Ramtha's School of Enlightenment, and spoken to family and friends of survivors of NXIUM, Jonestown, and more. Many guests have been featured on other shows about cults, including Leah Remini's 'Scientology and the Aftermath'.

episodes.title: Creationists & the Evolution of 'Stated Clearly' ~ with Jon Perry
episodes.description:
Stated Clearly is a popular science-based YouTube channel that offers up highly watchable animations that explain evolution, DNA, and science in general. The Stated Clearly animations have been used in schools and lectures, and have spawned a sister channel, Stated Casually.

MARK from Talk Beliefs catches up with Stated Clearly's founder, JON PERRY from his new base in Montreal, to talk about the origins of Stated Clearly, the secrets of his animations, and the highs & lows of championing evolution - including constant threats from Creationists.


01:00 Why did you create 'Stated Clearly'?
04:55 CLIP from What is the Evidence for Evolution?
05:53 What are the basic misunderstandings surrounding evolution?
08:10 Why do creationists get so upset about evolution?
16:20 Talk about your video'Soft Tissue Found Inside A T-Rex Bone'
18:41 CLIP from 'Soft Tissue found Inside A Dinosaur Bone'
26:47 What do you hope your work will achieve in the long run?

episodes.title: Why I Regret Working for a Christian Reform School ~ Interview with Mary Powell
episodes.description:
'As a former staff member for New Horizons Youth Ministries, working on all three campuses, NHYM Marion, MWA and Escuela Caribe, I witnessed bullying and intimidation of staff members that challenge the authority and practices of their superiors and fellow staff members.' ~ Mary Powell

MARK from Talk Beliefs speaks with MARY POWELL, former staff member of Escuela Caribe - a Christian reform school and boot camp located in the Dominican Republic. Here, she explains her regret at having become a housemother in an institution where she saw harsh punishments, unchecked control and lack of empathy for the troubled teens who were sent there - often forcibly - by their parents.

episodes.title: Secrets of the Moonies ~ with Teddy Hose [Ex-Unification Church]
episodes.description:
Photo -illustrated interview with TEDDY HOSE, a former member of the Unification Church (the 'Moonies'), known for its unusual practices including stadium-filled mass weddings. 

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks with Teddy about the Unification Church, how it controls its members, and the incident that convinced him that he had to leave.

Teddy is an artist, humorist and contributor for The Huffington Post, The Bold Italic, and McSweeney's. He recently appeared on the A&E documentary series, Cults & Extreme Belief. Now - he returns to Talk Beliefs to tell more of his powerful story.

episodes.title: Torn - Why I Left Judaism ~ Rebecca Goldstein
episodes.description:
Philosopher and author REBECCA NEWBERGER GOLDSTEIN talks candidly about her life growing up in an Orthodox Jewish family, and how doubts and questions began to creep in and ultimately led her away from belief in God and on to reason.

Christopher Johnson, director of the documentary, A Better Life, interviews Rebecca from her NYU office in New York. Rebecca has won many awards including the 2014 National Humanities Medal (presented September 10, 2015 at the White House by President Barack Obama). She is married to cognitive psychologist Steven Pinker.

Many thanks to ETAN BLASS and CHRISTOPHER JOHNSON for their kind permission to use this interview on Talk Beliefs.

episodes.title: Hard Time in a Christian Boot Camp ~ with Deirdre Sugiuchi
episodes.description:
Photo-illustrated interview with DEIRDRE SUGIUCHI - survivor of the Escuela Caribe 'behavioural modification camp' (as seen in the documentary Kidnapped for Christ). 

MARK from Talk Beliefs has a one-on-one with Deirdre as she calls in from her home in Athens, Georgia in the USA. Deirdre tells of unrelenting rules, invasion of privacy, and controlling staff who made her life hell during her incarceration at the camp in 1990 when she was 15.

Now she is putting the finishing touches on Unreformed - a tell-all book about her experiences in Escuela Caribe. Here, you will get a preview of what went on deep within the Dominican Republic, in a reform school run supposedly on Christian values.

Downtown Athens, GA footage by Russell Oliver

episodes.title: JW Protest Stories & Surprises ~ DEBRIEF with Louise Goode (ex-Jehovah's Witness)
episodes.description:
A one-on-one 'protest debrief' with LOUISE GOODE - organizer of the August 2018 JW Protest outside the Jehovah's Witnesses official convention at ExCel Arena, London, on August 11 & 12, and August 18 & 19, 2018. 

Here, we reflect on the four days of protests, how it went, what was learned and what potential protests in future should think about. 

MARK from Talk Beliefs catches up again with Louise, discussing the success of the event and the numerous stories (and surprises!) that came out of the biggest protest against the policies of the Watchtower in UK history.

[RECORDED AUGUST 22, 2018]

episodes.title: The London Protest - Ex-Jehovah's Witnesses Speak Out
episodes.description:
[PART TWO OF TWO] On Saturday, August 11th, 2018, the first of four protests against the policies of the Jehovah's Witnesses organization took place in London at the ExCel Convention Center.

With what turned out to be one of the biggest protests against JW.org of its kind, ex-members and others carried signs, banners, and illustrations of how the religion - deemed by many as a cult - has harmed and disenfranchised them through cruel doctrines. These include doctrines that protect pedophiles and prohibit life-saving blood transfusions.

MARK from Talk Beliefs along with MEG from the Meg Slaymaker YouTube channel document this first day of protest, talking to protesters, Jehovah's Witnesses, and the public.

episodes.title: Secret Audio Inside Jehovah's Witnesses 'Judicial Committee' Meeting
episodes.description:
Presented here is specially enhanced audio that was recorded covertly during a 'Judicial Committee Meeting' of the Jehovah's Witnesses in Liverpool in 2013.

Sam Powell was expelled ('disfellowshipped') from her congregation in 2011 for speaking out about the domestic troubles in her own home & for asking that the police be alerted.

The purpose of a Judicial Committee Meeting is so that the Elders can determine if the expelled member is repentant enough to return...

Many thanks to SAM POWELL for her kind permission to use her recording.

Special thanks to audio engineer Ian (aka 'looknowsee') for his cleanup of this audio: http://bit.ly/2wb2PFo

episodes.title: The London Protest - Jehovah's Witnesses React
episodes.description:
*Apologies for low sound at start. Go to extended version for new edit. :-) https://youtu.be/lpPlt7xCP7c

[PART ONE OF TWO] On Saturday, August 11th, 2018, the first of four protests against the policies of the Jehovah's Witnesses organization took place in London at the ExCel Convention Center.

With what turned out to be one of the biggest protests against JW.org of its kind, ex-members and others carried signs, banners, and illustrations of how the religion - deemed by many as a cult - has harmed and disenfranchised them through cruel doctrines. These include doctrines that protect pedophiles and prohibit life-saving blood transfusions.

MARK from Talk Beliefs along with MEG from the Meg Slaymaker YouTube channel document this first day of protest, talking to protesters, Jehovah's Witnesses, and the public.

WATCH OUT FOR PART TWO - COMING SOON!

episodes.title: Over the Moon - Escaping the Unification Church
episodes.description:
Photo-illustrated interview with TEDDY HOSE, a former member of the Unification Church (the 'Moonies'), known for its odd practices including stadium-filled mass weddings.

Growing up, Teddy knew the Moon family well, including Reverend Moon's youngest son, Sean - now leader of the infamous splinter group, the Sanctuary Church. 

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks with Teddy about the Unification Church, its splinter group, the Sanctuary Church, and the dangerous rituals of this offshoot sect - practices that Teddy considers to be highly dangerous.

Teddy recently appeared on the A&E documentary series, Cults & Extreme Belief. Now - he tells his powerful story in even greater detail. 

Teddy returns to Talk Beliefs for Secrets of the Moonies: https://goo.gl/XHjBhx

episodes.title: The REAL Jesus Camp - Christian Reform School Survivor Speaks Out
episodes.description:
MARK from Talk Beliefs presents a photo-illustrated interview with MARSHA METZ, as part of a series on religious 'boot camps' and reform schools.

Punishments, push-ups, incarcerations - all in the name of God. Christian 'behavioral modification camps' exist to do one thing - take a child or teen who is not behaving in the Christian way, and fix them.  Most are taken there against their will, and many cannot leave even after their 18th birthday. 

MARSHA METZ is 43 years old and lives near Seattle, a survivor still haunted by her years in Escuela Caribe - a Christian reform camp in the Dominican Republic. From 16 to 19, she endured scrutiny and harsh punishments from employees meant to be caring houseparents and people of God.

Here, Marsha speaks out with passion and great attention to detail about her time at the camp, and how it has affected her life since her return home.

Today, she runs a support group for other survivors of Escuela Caribe.

episodes.title: Interviewing Hare Krishnas ~ Devotion or Delusion?
episodes.description:
I go along to 'Mantra & Meditation in the Park' to meet the local Hare Krishnas and talk about their beliefs, background, and just why chanting 'Hare Krishna' all day long is a way to 'sublime happiness'. 

We hear from four different devotees - a man who has been in the movement since the 1970s, a woman whose life was 'saved' after a car accident, a young Jewish convert, and a 17-year-old boy who was born into the Hare Krishnas. 

Mind-expanding... or mindless chanting? You be the judge.

episodes.title: Was Charles Darwin a Monster? ~ with Barry Desborough
episodes.description:
Charles Darwin is known for 'On the Origin of Species' and for outlining the biological process of evolution, but why do so many see him as not only wrong, but immoral? What exactly is 'social darwinism' and was Darwin really in favor of cleansing the 'unfit' from the world, as the so-called 'survival of the fittest' suggests? 

BARRY DESBOROUGH returns to Talk Beliefs to give an overview of Darwin's discoveries, outlook, and intentions. Was he a good man... or a monster?

Barry Desborough studied at Christchurch college, Canterbury (now a part of Kent University, Canterbury, UK.) and gained a Diploma in Education. His childhood in Malaysia in the 1960s, observing the casual racism of colonials, led to research into evolutionary psychology and human nature.

LINKS FOR BARRY DESBOROUGH:
