episodes.title: Update on the Exclusive Brethren with Jacky Hart - Talk Beliefs News Interview SPECIAL
episodes.description:
Talk Beliefs News - Photo-Illustrated Audio YouTube Podcast for June 19th, 2018.

JACKY HART (ex-Exclusive Brethren) revisits Talk Beliefs. Today, Jacky comes to the studio to give Mark and Neal an update on the Exclusive Brethren, their isolationist practices, and information for those within the sect who wish to leave.

The Exclusive Brethren (recently re-branded as the Plymouth Brethren) is a sect of Protestantism that practices 'exclusion from evil', that is, isolation from the world, even going as far as avoiding eating with non-brethren. 

Many who grow up in the sect are dissatisfied with this restrictive life and endeavor to leave, but family and doctrinal ties make leaving extremely difficult. There are often harsh punishments for those who do not tow the Brethren line...

#exexclusivebrethren #cults #belief



LINKS FOR THIS EPISODE:

Jacky Hart: My Escape from the Exclusive Brethren - A Talk & Presentation ~ Jacky Hart http://bit.ly/2toPW8l

WikiPeebia - support website for anyone who is within the Exclusive Brethren and wishes to leave but is finding it difficult. Look for the big red button on the homepage and press - this will send an email to a person who can help you. http://wikipeebia.com/

episodes.title: The Children of Cults - Dr. Janja Lalich - Special London Talk, June 2018
episodes.description:
Talk Beliefs is pleased to present a recording of a talk by cult expert, Dr Janja Lalich: What Can We Learn From The Children of Cults?'

DR JANJA LALICH, Ph.D. is a researcher, author, and educator and is Professor Emerita of Sociology at California State University, Chico. 

Dr Lalich has been studying the social psychology of groups known as "cults" for thirty years. She is the author of several books on the subject, including the newly-released Escaping Utopia: Growing Up in a Cult, Getting Out and Starting Over. 

This book is co-authored with award-winning author and social science researcher KARLA MCLAREN, M.Ed..

This special London talk focuses on the work from her new book - an original research conducted with sixty-five cult survivors from thirty-nine cultic groups in more than a dozen countries. 

Hosted by Alexandra Stein, Ph.D, social psychologist.

#talkbeliefs #belief #cults

'What Can We Learn From The Children of Cults' was recorded on Wednesday, June 6th, 2018, at The University Women’s Club, 2 Audley Square, London, U.K.

episodes.title: Interviewing Evangelicals ~ Holy Spirit or Happenstance?
episodes.description:
Another 'Praise in the Park' hits my town, and another chance to interview Christians about their faith. The theme is Pentecost and the power of the Holy Spirit. I learn that this spirit moves like the wind and can even cure constipation (!). 

I speak to two worship leaders and one young Christian family who have all experienced the Holy Spirit in their lives... and attempt to explain how they know that it was indeed the Holy Spirit, and not coincidence or emotion.

How exactly does one have a 'relationship' with an entity that can't be seen or heard? The people I speak to assure me that you can indeed have a relationship - and more.

Miracles or Magic? Interviewing Evangelicals (2017): http://bit.ly/2IxGz0w

© Copyright 2018 by Talk Beliefs (Re-use allowed with permission.

episodes.title: Update on Cults & New Cult Activity with Alexandra Stein ~Talk Beliefs News Interview SPECIAL
episodes.description:
Talk Beliefs News - Photo-Illustrated Audio YouTube Podcast for June 6th, 2018.

SPECIAL EPISODE: 

MARK from Talk Beliefs chats with ALEXANDRA STEIN, Ph.D - a writer and educator specializing in the social psychology of ideologies and other dangerous social relationships.

Mark discusses with Alexandra why cults are still manifesting themselves in today's society, and what to look out for. New cults (such as UCKG) are just the tip of the iceberg. We also talk about the success of the Leah Remini show, 'The Handmaid's Tale' drama from Hulu, and the growing fascination with cults in general.

episodes.title: Is Ireland an Atheist Country? An Atheist and a Christian Respond!
episodes.description:
Until recently, the Republic of Ireland has been a conservative, Catholic country -- where even divorce was illegal until 1996. 

Today, with an increasingly tuned-in, progressive, multicultural society and a population largely disillusioned with the Catholic church and its many scandals, secularism and atheism are on the rise. But does that apply to everybody?

I visit Galway City's bustling and very colorful Shop Street on a busy Saturday to meet KELVIN O'CONNOR of Atheist Ireland at their monthly table, as well as a Christian evangelist PHILIP who has his own table virtually across the street from the young heathens!

01:20 KELVIN of Atheist Ireland ~ Part One
04:33 Christian Evangelist PHILIP
12:00 KELVIN of Atheist Ireland ~ Part Two

Filmed with the Removu K1 gimble-cam.

SEE ALSO: Does an Unborn Baby Have A Soul? Pro Life vs Pro Choice in Ireland https://bit.ly/2swUOsn

episodes.title: Talking LDS Controversies with Mormon Missionary Girls
episodes.description:
A chance meeting with two brightly-smiling Mormon Missionary girls who approach me in my town's main shopping thoroughfare. 

Bright-eyed and bushy-tailed as always, these two Latter Day Saints are very keen on discussing their wonderful holy book, and even tell me what they think of the Book of Mormon Broadway show! 

But, in the end, don't seem very clued up on some of the more controversial aspects of their religion (such as baptizing of Holocaust victims 14:23). You be the judge!

[RE-UPLOAD]

episodes.title: Pro Life & Pro Choice in Ireland - the Public Decide
episodes.description:
The Pro Choice / Pro Life issue comes to a head this week in Ireland, when a historic referendum vote held on Friday, May 25, 2018, will decide whether or not to repeal the 8th Amendment - which recognizes the equal right to life of the mother and the unborn.

MARK from Talk Beliefs speaks to one of the canvassers, John, a campaigner for the 'Yes' (Repeal) side of the equation, and supporter of feminist ideals and the right for a woman to have autonomy over her own body.

We talk about the upcoming referendum, the incredible progress made in the conservative, Catholic country of Ireland, as well as the concept of 'soul insertion' - the notion (held by many religious people) that a soul is installed in an individual at the moment of conception.

(Look out for the random Jehovah's Witness reference!)

SEE ALSO: Is Ireland an Atheist Country? https://bit.ly/2HkRwxj

episodes.title: Are Jehovah's Witnesses A Cult? ~ with Meg Slaymaker
episodes.description:
Ex-Jehovah's Witness and YouTuber MEG SLAYMAKER gives us her thoughts on cults, and why the Jehovah's Witnesses may be considered a cult. 

Photo-illustrated throughout, Meg looks at mind control, brainwashing, cults in general and how to spot them. 

Are you in a cult? You may very well be...

01:17 The Public Perception of Cults
02:19 Cult Experts
04:01 Types of Cults
05:55 How People Get Involved In Cults
07:54 Mind Control vs Brainwashing
09:43 Cognitive Dissonance
15:51 The Control Factor
18:10 JWs vs 'Worldly' People
20:07 Decision Making
23:00 The Practice of 'Disfellowshipping'
24:38 Information Control
26:28 Wrapping Up & Thank you!

Steven Hassan Website: https://freedomofmind.com/

episodes.title: Mormon Magic Objects
episodes.description:
The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints (aka the Mormons) have a heck of a lot of things to believe in, more than your average Christian...

This overview showcases some of the weird and wonderful objects revered by the faith founded by Joseph Smith in Upstate New York in 1830. They are pretty awesome if they're real. Thanos would love to get his hands on them.

Holy & supernatural, or wholly hogwash? You be the judge.

episodes.title: When Masculinity Is Threatened ~ London's Speakers Corner
episodes.description:
Talk Beliefs takes its curious lens to London's Hyde Park and to the famed Speakers Corner - where, for over 150 years, the public have been given free reign to get on their soapbox and bullhorn out their opinions on just about everything!

I am caught in the middle of an anti-right group who march and bash out loud music, attracting plenty of onlookers - and police. I also bump into author and journalist Laurie Penny, who confronts a man who believes that males are being treated unfairly by women. 

And not to forget the bellicose Bible Basher who says that we (the crowd) are crazy with sin, love chaos, and are dressed 'like cowards'. 

I cant help but notice that the railings of red-blooded, testosterone-filled men against the encroachment of femininity into their worlds seems to be the theme of the day. 

Just another normal Sunday at Speakers Corner!


[Filmed with the Removu K1 and edited on Filmora 8.5.1 editsuite.]

episodes.title: How Does Peer Review Work? ~  with Matt Berkowitz
episodes.description:
How Does Peer Review Work - with Matt Berkowitz of the Science Literacy YouTube Channel (link below).

What is evidence? How can we evaluate it? What makes some scientific evidence more reliable than other scientific evidence?

This video looks at the framework of the peer review system in science, identifies what is known as the “hierarchy of evidence”, and examines a checklist we can apply to different scientific claims to help us assess their reliability.

This is video 5.1 of this series, 5.2 etc will be viewable soon on Matt's channel (see link below).

[MIRROR FROM SCIENCE LITERACY YOUTUBE CHANNEL]

Many thanks to Matt Berkowitz for his kind permission to use his video.

episodes.title: Exclusive Brethren - RARE 1976 Exposé Documentary: 'Doctrine That Divides'
episodes.description:
'In my opinion, the Brethren killed them.' 

So begins this rarely-seen BBC Omnibus documentary that investigates the secretive isolationist Protestant sect, the Exclusive Brethren (today re-branded as Plymouth Brethren).

Shocking, heartbreaking, and revelatory, the documentary team speaks to ex-members of the sect - a sect many deem as destructive cult - to find out just what happens if you break even one of the group's stringent rules.

Presented as part of Talk Beliefs' CULT VIEWING series (playlist HERE: https://goo.gl/PtHmDi)

LINKS:

Book by Rebecca Stott. 

Rebecca's father, Roger, was an officer in the Brethren and appears in this documentary (see timecode 11:40).

In the Days of Rain by Rebecca Stott  https://goo.gl/psWUUF

episodes.title: Is A God Necessary? The Evolution of Morality ~ with Dr Oliver Scott Curry
episodes.description:
Interview with evolutionary anthropologist, Dr Oliver Scott Curry.

Do we need a God to give us morals?

DR OLIVER SCOTT CURRY is a Senior Researcher at the Institute of Cognitive and Evolutionary Anthropology, University of Oxford. He has tested this theory of ‘morality as cooperation’ by means of a comprehensive cross-cultural survey of moral values. 

TALK BELIEFS catches up with Dr Curry at the London School of Economics Library, and asks about how morals, ethics, & altruism could have come about via evolutionary means, rather than a God handing down a series of Commandments.

© Copyright 2018 by Talk Beliefs (Re-use allowed with permission)


00:00 START
00:28 What does your research entail?
02:44 How did you become interested in the subject of morality?
06:13 Did you have a religious upbringing?
07:38 A 'perfect standard'?
11:49 Pushback from the religious?
12:28 A core morality
16:50 Moral relativism
19:50 Upcoming projects

episodes.title: Apologists & Apostates - Is There A Difference?
episodes.description:
'What is the difference between an apologist (a defender of a particular faith) and an apostate (one who has left a faith) on a psychological level? How is it that two different people could look at the doctrines of Mormonism (or Christianity, Islam, etc) and come to totally different conclusions? What is going on in their minds?

A thought-provoking presentation given by ex-Mormon activist & podcaster, Shawn, in Canberra, Australia at a Mormon Stories Australia get-together - with slides, imagery, and video clips, and a lot of fun and insights from the small audience of ex-Mormons.

Fascinating viewing for ex-Mormons, ex-Christians, or anyone who has left his or her faith behind. [MIRROR FROM MORMON STORIES AUSTRALIA]

02:20 CLIP: Parable of the Sower (often used by apologists to attack apostates)

22:12 CLIP: Mormon apologist Scott Gordon criticizing Mormon apologist Rod Meldrum.


Definitions:

Apostate - a person who gives up his religion, cause, party, etc.

Apologist - a person who makes a defense in speech or writing of a belief, idea, etc, especially of contradictory or difficult ideas.

Apologetics - defense or proof given for a religion, politics, etc.

LDS - Latter-day Saints (Mormons).

**********

episodes.title: Evidence for Evolution - with Barry Desborough
episodes.description:
What is the best evidence for evolution? 

MARK from Talk Beliefs talks to researcher Barry Desborough about evidences for evolution, including ERVs (Endongenous Retroviruses) as an excellent proof of common descent. We discuss his ongoing clash with Creationists, and why their arguments are based largely on a misunderstanding of evolution.

BARRY DESBOROUGH has studied at Christchurch college, Canterbury (now a part of Kent University, Canterbury, UK.), gaining a Diploma in Education. His childhood in Malaysia in the 1960s, observing the casual racism of colonials, led to research into evolutionary psychology and human nature - what is it about human beings that makes us behave the way we do, good and bad?

Barry runs several Facebooks groups on the subject of evolution, and has contributed to Wikipedia.
#talkbeliefs #evolution #science

SEE ALSO:

episodes.description:
What causes people to deny science? MATT BERKOWITZ of the Science Literacy YouTube channel looks at the psychological and ideological factors that motivate people to deny established scientific findings. 

Mirror upload from the Science Literacy YouTube channel - which is dedicated to improving public science literacy. episodes.title: Creationists Vs Transitional Fossils - DEBUNKED!
episodes.description:
Genesis Apologetics smacks a line-drive straight into the dugout with this one - a sniggering critique of famous fossils Archaeopteryx and Tiktaalik, prehistoric creatures which clearly show traits of a transition between animal groups.

Bad science or anti-evolution smoke-and-mirrors? Once again, Talk Beliefs asks you to be the judge. ;-)

Link to original Genesis Apologetics video: https://goo.gl/GA1f3Z

Links to other Talk Beliefs response videos:
Anti-Evolution Classroom Rant - Debunked! https://goo.gl/qyvqAX
Creationist Takedown of Lucy - Debunked! https://goo.gl/2LdVZp
Debunking 'Ape-Men Inconsistencies' - https://goo.gl/rv2aWh

**********

A big thank you to:  Bill Ludlow and Alex Reubenstahl, for their help in the making of this video response!

BILL LUDLOW studied Geology and Anthropology at Michigan State University and has been an avid amateur geologist, paleontologist, and fossil collector for many years. 
He is currently the Origins Expert for the Origins Gallery at the Arizona Museum of Natural History. 

 
ALEX REUBENSTAHL studies at George Washington University,  Washington, D.C., currently finishing up his geology undergraduate and biology undergraduate degree. 
Alex looks forward to beginning his Paleo bio masters work on early crocodile evolution in DC in 2018. He’s worked in the field in Lesotho, South Africa -- and soon in China. 
Dr. James Clark, Professor of Biology, is his advisor.

episodes.title:
What Do
Baha'is Believe?
episodes.description:
What do Bahá'ís believe?  Short overview of the Bahá'í Faith. 

Established in Persia by Bahá'u'lláh in 1863, the Bahá'í religion embraces all faiths, seeing all as worthy, and teachers such as Jesus, Buddha and Zoroaster as all part of the divine message. 

Bahá'ís hope for a world of complete unity, where racism, gender inequality, and class systems do not exist. The spiritual home of the Bahá'ís is Israel -- there, the Bahá'í World Center comprises several magnificent buildings and shrines, including the burial shrine of Bahá'u'lláh.

Thumbnail image: New Baha’i temple in Santiago, Chile.

Credits for imagery used in this video: Marie Blanc Durand; Exyator; Zoom Shots; David Erwin

Zoroaster artwork courtesy Mitchell Nolte: https://www.mitchellnolte.com

episodes.title: Secrets of Krishna Venta &  the 'Fountain of the World' Cult ~ with Callie Shanafelt
episodes.description:
It’s the cult where mass-murderer Charles Manson hung out, it's the cult you’ve never heard of - the 'Fountain of the World', headed by one of the earliest 20th century Jesus wannabes, Krishna Venta. It's a story of deceit, deception and ultimately destruction when the cult's followers turned on their leader by way of a suicide bombing.

CALLIE SHANAFELT is a California based filmmaker whose father, uncle, and grandparents were in the Fountain cult. Her documentary, The Fountain, takes us on a journey of discovery to revisit the commune and come to terms with the horrific tragedy that took the lives of her grandparents.

MARK from Talk Beliefs catches up with Callie, linking up with her in her editing studio in California, to talk about the documentary and reveal intriguing details and bizarre facts she uncovered during her research into the Fountain of the World cult.

Clips of Krishna Venta in London via https://www.britishpathe.com/

episodes.title: Interview with the Son of God (Siberian Jesus)
episodes.description:
In a distant region among the forests of Russia, Jesus Christ walks the earth again. At least, that is the claim of Vissarion, a man who says he is the reincarnated Son of God. Many people believe him, and a community has risen around this mysterious man – a community some dismiss as a cult.

TOM CLARKE, during his final year at Glasgow University, made it his mission to understand the Vissarion Community. Travelling to the Siberian Taiga forests, spending five days at the Abode of Dawn; he recorded his experiences, with footage ranging from a spine tingling ceremony to an interview with the supposed messiah himself.

A deluded zealot who has deceived others? A cynical con-man with a flair for theater? Or maybe – just maybe -- something more? Watch and decide for yourself.

Presented as part of Talk Beliefs' CULT VIEWING series.

**********

A very big thank you to Tom Clarke for his kind permission to use his film, 'Meeting the Son of God'.

episodes.title: I Was Kidnapped For Christ - Interview with David Wernsman
episodes.description:
Mark from Talk Beliefs hosts a photo-illustrated interview with David Wernsman, focus of the 2014 award-winning documentary, 'Kidnapped for Christ' - directed by Kate Logan.

'Kidnapped for Christ' documents the plight of teens sent forcibly by their parents to an evangelical 'behavior modification camp' located in the Dominican Republic - as was done so with David, who had simply come out as gay.

Taken in the middle of the night against his will, David spent long months in the Escuela Caribe school, suffering harsh punishments for the slightest infractions, scared he'd never be able to leave ... until filmmaker Kate Logan - originally in favor of the school - helped him escape. 

DAVID TELLS A STORY THAT GOES BEYOND THE DOCUMENTARY, AND REVEALS SOME BRUTAL FACTS OF MISTREATMENT WITHIN THE CAMP THAT NEVER MADE IT INTO THE FILM.

#kidnappedforchrist #jesuscamp #beliefs

episodes.title: Digging Facts, Debunking Creationists ~ with Bill Ludlow
episodes.description:
Mark from Talk Beliefs hosts a photo-illustrated interview with Bill Ludlow on the Creation-Evolution question, debating Creationists, his recent discovery of pre-dinosaur mammal-like reptile tracks, and a lot more!

Bill Ludlow is an avid amateur geologist, paleontologist, and fossil collector. He spends much of his time in the field in Arizona studying the landscape and searching for fossils.  He is currently the Human Origins Expert for the Origins Gallery at the Arizona Museum of Natural History.  

His interest in the Creation/Evolution controversy began in college during discussions with classmates and grew after discovering internet forums and more recently Facebook groups dedicated to the subject.  

He recently debated well-known Creationist apologist Kent Hovind and talks about his experience.

(This interview copyright 2017 by Talk Beliefs)

episodes.title: Creation vs Evolution - Hope (Response!)
episodes.description:
A critical response to the Christian video 'Creation vs Evolution: Hope', made by The Veracity Project and showcased by the Genesis Creation Science Institute (GCSI).

Miserable 'Evolution' explains to chipper 'Creation' that all he has to look forward to is hopelessness and destruction, much to the astonishment of Creation, who tells him that at least he has hope.

Is the Theory of Evolution just another doctrine, albeit one that offers no meaning or purpose? Talk Beliefs doesn't think so, and explains why.

episodes.title: Problems In The Bible - Ex-Believer Road Trip
episodes.description:
Join ex-believers Shawn and Dan on another road trip down the East Coast of Australia as they explore the most obvious problems in the Bible such as evidences of polytheism and the contradictions found within the four New Testament gospels of the allegedly inerrant Word of God.

SHAWN was brought up Mormon in South Africa and served as a Mormon Missionary in his late teens, before leaving his faith and becoming an atheist. He now lives in Australia and writes & podcasts about Mormonism and being an ex-Mormon. He has contributed many times to Talk Beliefs.

DANIEL is a former Anglican/Evangelical Christian. Baptised at age 18, he finally left church after 22 years when a post-grad course in biblical studies challenged some of his most cherished beliefs. He now uses his extensive biblical knowledge to discuss problems within the scriptures with believers and non-believers alike.

episodes.description:
Listen in on a chance meeting with a Korean evangelizing family in a bustling shopping thoroughfare. As husband and wife sing endless amplified Jesus-y songs, their 20-something daughter hands out religious tracts and talks to passersby about her faith. 

She tells me about how her family travel from town-to-town singing and preaching, and that some towns - including mine - can be 'rough' since people often shout at them. Which is exactly what happens while we are having our little chat!

YouTube's The Nuclear Humanist presents a talk about climate change and nuclear energy.

Mathijs ('Thies') Beckers - The Nuclear Humanist - is an author and activist from the Netherlands, who blogs and makes videos about nuclear energy, debunking the myths and beliefs surrounding it.

episodes.title: Miracles or Magic? Interviewing Evangelicals
episodes.description:
Today I check out a local 'Praise in the Park' - a Christian event in Cassiobury Park, Watford, UK, twenty miles outside of London. I speak to two evangelicals who have very different backgrounds - one who grew up in a Christian family, and one who knew nothing but atheism until an apparent miraculous event changed his mind. I ask both about challenges to their faith.

MICHAEL was born into an evangelical family. He describes himself as being 'in the world but apart from it'. He tells me he is concerned about the state of the world, what with single parent family & gay marriage being so prominent. When challenged, Michael calls upon the Holy Spirit.

ANDY came out of a humanist background. But when his troublemaker brother was healed from a gastric pain at a Christian event, Andy began to follow the teachings of Jesus & joined the neo-charismatic New Frontiers. But there are still challenges - like still trying to figure out why his mother got cancer within six months of becoming a Christian...

More on New Frontiers:
I Grew Up in a Religious Cult in Essex http://bit.ly/2sriHmC

episodes.title: Evolution or God's Design? Interview with Creationist Stuart Burgess
episodes.description:
Talk Beliefs interviews Stuart Burgess, Professor of Engineering Design at the University of Bristol. This is a first for Talk Beliefs interviews, as Professor Burgess is a Creationist*. He regularly speaks at Creation events and has recently been interviewed by Ken Ham for Answers in Genesis.

I catch up with Prof Burgess after his presentation, The Uniqueness of Man, and ask about his views on the human body as a complex structure, referring to his talk which highlights the many remarkable attributes of the human body and how we differ markedly from apes. 

As a Creationist, Professor Burgess is concerned about how the teaching of evolution affects children, since it does not tell them that they are a special creation with a special purpose. 

*This particular interview was not intended to be confrontational, but more to explore how a creationist thinks. Hope you enjoy!

********
Prof. Stuart Burgess' research interests include bio-inspired design, biomechanics and design in nature. He has worked as a professional designer and spent five years at the European Space Agency. As well as authoring several Creationist publications, he has published over 140 secular papers on the science of design, and as well as his work at Bristol University has also lectured Cambridge University.

NOTE: The clips from the Uniqueness of Man talk are from another presentation that was held at an earlier date & venue, and can be seen in full here: http://bit.ly/2rqVAYE

By Stuart Burgess:
Hallmarks of Design: Evidence of Design in the Natural World http://amzn.to/2rpyYrv

********

Talk Beliefs fights fire with science in this evidence-based smackdown of 'Debunk Evolution Classroom Promo Video' (by Genesis Apologetics) which urges Christian teens to boycott biology lessons that dare to teach evolution.

Fifteen-year-old High School student, Kayla, just 'can't understand' how the process of evolution can possibly work (despite having been taught it for weeks) and goes on a wild rant about its faults and absurdities... as she sees it. 

Should pupils from religious backgrounds refuse to learn topics that contradict their faith, or just shut up and do the work? You be the judge.

A fascinating insight to the little-known secret world of the Mormon Missionary, revealed by an ex-Mormon. Shawn was a Mormon Missionary in 2007 & 2008, sent from his home in South Africa to the North West of England to try to win souls for the LDS church.

episodes.title: The Secret World of a Mormon Missionary
episodes.description:
A photo-illustrated one-to-one between MARK from Talk Beliefs and SHAWN, an ex-Mormon & one-time Mormon Missionary now living in Sydney, Australia.

A fascinating insight to the little-known secret world of the Mormon Missionary, revealed by an ex-Mormon. Shawn was a Mormon Missionary from 2007 to 2009, sent from his home in South Africa to the North West of England to try to win souls for the LDS church. 

Shawn reveals how young men are chosen, trained, and then assigned (often to far-away countries), along with daily rituals, and rules that can seem strange -- such as not being able to contact family, and always being within eye-contact of their missionary companion.

On his two year mission, Shawn experienced rejection, attacks, depression - and ultimately deep-seated doubts that led him to reject Mormonism and become an atheist.

episodes.title: Going Critical - Interview with Chris Shelton, ex-Scientologist
episodes.description:
Ab illustrated one-to-one between Mark from Talk Beliefs and CHRIS SHELTON, ex-Scientologist.

Chris Shelton grew up in a Scientology family, joining at age 15, and enlisting in the 'Sea Org' - the religion's elite management organization.

In 2013, having experienced serious doubts about the religion, he left and was subsequently declared a Suppressive Person for publicly speaking out against Scientology. 

Recently, Chris has appeared on the hit A&E television show, Scientology and the Aftermath, with Leah Remini.

Chris now has a very successful YouTube channel where he has hundreds of videos about Scientology and critical thinking. He also hosts the Sensibly Speaking podcast.

Talk Beliefs catches up with Chris and discusses what specifically caused him to leave Scientology, about the secretive Saint Hill Manor in England, and what the religion's late founder, L Ron Hubbard, really believed. Plus plenty more fascinating first-hand insights into the mysterious and often bizarre world of a religion many deem to be a cult.



#belief #exscientologist #cults

episodes.title: Cults & Cult Leaders - Talk by Alexandra Stein, PhD
episodes.description:
Cult expert & author, Alexandra Stein, PhD, at the Reason Coffee Shop and Bookstore, Watford, Hertfordshire, UK. Alexandra answers questions from the audience as well as sharing frightening revelations from her own past trapped in an oppressive  & highly-controlling cult called 'The O'.

Written by a cult survivor and renowned expert on cults and totalitarianism, Terror, Love and Brainwashing draws on the author’s 25 years of study and research to explain how almost anyone, given the right set of circumstances, can be radically manipulated to engage in otherwise incomprehensible and often dangerous acts.

TalkBeliefs in association with the Reason Coffee Shop and Bookstore presents Alexandra on the release of her latest book on cults: Terror, Love and Brainwashing: Attachment in Cults and Totalitarian Systems, which focuses on how charismatic cult leaders target social attachments (such as family) to seduce and control potential followers.

episodes.title: My Escape from the Exclusive Brethren - Q & A with Jacky Hart
episodes.description:
Jacky Hart lives in the UK and grew up as a part of the isolationist Protestant Christian sect, the Exclusive Brethren - regarded by some as a cult. She tells an emotional story of how she & her family were scrutinized, restricted, and indoctrinated by an organization that shuns the outside world and frowns upon members who no longer want to live within their walls.

Now Jacky works to help ex-Exclusive Brethren as well as those within the Exclusive Brethren who feel disaffected and wish to leave.

The talk & presentation was recorded for Talk Beliefs at the Reason Coffee Shop and Bookstore, UK, in front of an audience on March 23rd, 2017.

episodes.title: When Mormons Get Mad
episodes.description:
Listen in on a meeting with two Mormon Missionaries. Accepting the invitation of the bright-eyed youths, I agree to hear their 'message' in a quiet cafe in back of my local library. 

But the moment I start to allude to the controversies within the LDS church (you know, polygamy, mistreatment of blacks & gays, etc) one of the lads goes from bright-eyed to dagger-eyed. 

Tight lipped and on the verge of losing his Mormon cool, he holds his anger as well as a trained Missionary can manage, but does not do a very good job.

Could it be that his two year mission is finally getting to him? Too much rejection? Cognitive dissonance, anyone? 


Exploring - and challenging - what and why we believe.

Tumors, strokes, deafness, and demonic possession - you name it, he's healed it (in the name of Jesus, of course). He assures me he has plenty of testimonies to these cures -- though testimonies from doctors are not among them!

episodes.title: Cults & Brainwashing - Alexandra Stein, PhD (Cult Expert)
episodes.description:
RE-UPLOAD WITH IMPROVED IMAGE & SOUND

Alexandra Stein, Ph.D, is a writer and educator specializing in the social psychology of ideological extremism and other dangerous social relationships.

episodes.title: Secrets from the Cult - An Ex-Jehovah's Witness Speaks Out
episodes.description:
Presentation by Lydia Finch, ex-Jehovah's Witness, using visuals including disturbing clips from the Jehovah's Witnesses own website. 

Twenty years ago Lydia was expelled ('disfellowshipped') from the Jehovah's Witnesses for dating a boy outside the faith. To this day, close family members will not speak to her, as is decreed by JW practices. 

Today, Lydia helps others who are struggling with their lives after leaving the Witnesses. She presents a frank, no-holds-barred, and often shocking account of her life within a bizarre and closed world of a faith than many people deem to be a cult.

Topics covered include the practice of 'shunning' as well as allegations of child abuse within the sect.

UPDATE: One week after Lydia's talk this report is released: Jehovah's Witnesses did not protect children from abuse, inquiry finds (28 November 2016): http://bit.ly/2fE2UX5

*Apologies for variable quality of picture within this upload; recording is a rip from the Live Facebook event of Lydia's talk on the night.

episodes.title: Hare Krishna Devotee Compares Faith to Science
episodes.description:
A chance meeting (or is it?) with a Hare Krishna 'devotee' in a busy shopping thoroughfare. I am curious to know how this Englishman became a Hare Krishna and why he became convinced of its authenticity. 

As a youth he read many religious texts, only finding the stories of blue Hindu god, Krishna, to make sense to him. What convinced him was realization through meditation - in other words, a feeling that is like no other. That, apparently, is the standard. 

But believers from other faiths have told me exactly the same thing. I learn that faith is 'scientific' and that as a Hare Krishna you can actually see the gods while in spiritual trance. Also, good deeds are rewarded by Krishna, but ultimately, it is about pleasing him. Sounds suspiciously like all other faiths to me.

Follow @TalkBeliefs on Twitter!

If you enjoy my chats, slideshows, and interviews, I'd be very happy if you could support Talk Beliefs on Patreon!  
http://bit.ly/1p7TSpz

episodes.title: 'All Atheists Are Evil!'
episodes.description:
Listen in to a discussion with a lone proselytizer who has taken to the streets to spread the good news that people are bad!

He tells me how lost he once was, doing bad things, hanging around with the wrong people, until some friends told him about Jesus. Without even investigating the validity of these claims, he became a Christian. Everyone, I learn, are Christians deep inside. However - atheists are evil. And I mean all of 'em.
Hmm - contradictory, much?

episodes.title: Jehovah's Witnesses - Dissing Disfellowshipping
episodes.description:
Encounter with a pair of Jehovah's Witness girls in London, UK. After a discussion about their favourite topic (why the world is so evil) I turn the conversation to things uniquely JW - specifically, disfellowshipping. 

If a member of the congregation does something considered wrong or sinful (and this can be for the most innocuous of things), that person is expected to be 'disfellowshipped'. Essentially, kicked out of the church. Not just that, ignored. 

Bad enough if you are just another congregant, but what if your family is shunning you? Why do the Witnesses think this is a godly practice? I let them know exactly what I think of this ritual.

episodes.title: Why I Left Ultra-Orthodox Judaism - Naomi Kraushar
episodes.description:
Naomi Kraushar opens up about the challenges and benefits encountered on her journey from a closed Ultra-Orthodox Jewish community in London to pursuing a PhD at one of America's top universities. 

Growing up Ultra-Orthodox Jew is challenging for a woman, especially if you are a bisexual woman. Naomi reveals just how restrictive her upbringing was and how enormously freeing it has been to leave it all behind.

This video was a joint project between Talk Beliefs and My Derech (www.myderech.org)  .

******

If you are Chareidi (right-wing Yeshivish or Chasidish) and are considering a different "derech" (way), you are definitely not alone, and plenty of help is available:

In ISRAEL - http://www.hillel.org.il/ and https://www.facebook.com/groups/vayter/

In NEW YORK - http://footstepsorg.org/ and http://www.meetup.com/otdmeetup/

In LONDON - http://mavar.org/, and there's also a confidential support group for people who have left all different types of high-control groups -- email interexlondon at gmail. There's also a social group for ex-Chareidim who are openly "off the derech" -- http://www.geshereu.org.uk/.

The world's largest online group for formerly Orthodox Jews is Off the Derech - http://bit.ly/2dEJjGc

episodes.description:
Listen in on an a confrontation with a fired-up street evangelist armed with Christian tracts. He wants people to believe in Jesus, and not evolution, as it has been 'not been proven by science'.

I point out all the validating discoveries and transitional fossils, but counters with tales of flying snakes and that 'everybody believes in God.' He is surprised to hear Unicorns are mentioned in the Old Testament.

But when he says I should watch a video by Evangelist Ray Comfort, I cringe (you can almost feel my face-palm).

episodes.description:

A tween boy and girl appear out of nowhere during one of my street debates and take over the conversation, the smaller of the two (an 11 year old boy with robotic spiel and emotionless glare) quickly taking it upon himself to convert me and save my wretched atheist soul.

But something about his delivery is quite worrying to me. How did he become so sure of his faith at such a young age? What is his homelife like? And what will he become as he grows older?

episodes.title: Who Are The Hindu Gods?
episodes.description:
Do you know your Krishnas from your Shaktis? The ancient Hindu religion is known for its multitude of gods (some say many million offshoots of the original god, Brahma). They were the Avengers of their day, but for the outsider, these amazing avatars are not easily distinguishable. 

This presentation is a bite-sized overview of the main Hindu gods, their attributes, and (let's face it) coolness.

episodes.title: Cults & Brainwashing - Alexandra Stein, PhD (Cult Expert)
episodes.description:
Alexandra Stein, PhD, is a writer and educator specializing in the social psychology of extreme ideologies and other dangerous social relationships. She has appeared in television documentaries including 'Trapped In A Cult' for UK's Channel 5, and give talks and lectures around the UK, including Conway Hall in London, and the Reason Bookstore in Watford.

TalkBeliefs interviews Alexandra on her life in a cult, methods of brainwashing, what constitutes a cult, and how to educate the public on how to spot the warning signs of cult activity.

#cults #beliefs #religions

episodes.title: Confronting Church Apologists on LGBT Rights
episodes.description:
Listen in on a local London church during one of their weekly public talk events addressing negative views of Christianity. This week tacked Christianity and homosexuality. Attendees were invited to anonymously text in questions that could then be put to the panel after the main talk.

After building up an apologetic case designed to make modern Christians look sympathetic to LGBT rights and welcoming to gay people in general, the speakers then outlined why homosexuals can never have relationships, get married, or have sex if they want to join their church. 

After the event I approached two of the panel and let them know exactly what I thought of their event. 

[NOTE: If you'd like to skip directly to me confronting the panel, it starts at 1:10:16]
--------------------------
Below are a list of questions I had texted in before the event (questions with an asterisk are the questions they used):

As no Christian would condemn the emotional & sexual needs of heterosexuals,  is it in any way acceptable to condemn those of homosexuals?

*If an openly gay couple wanted to join your church, would you expect them to give up their private sexual acts?

* As Christians accept the Bible's condemnation of homosexuality,  why do they ignore other condemnations such as eating shrimp, getting tattoos,  women speaking in church, and stoning brides who aren't virgins?

* Since science has identified the 'gay gene', and determined that homosexuality is not a choice, where does that leave the bible verses that call it an 'abomination' and 'detestable'?

Christians say marriage is for procreation & gays should be denied children.  So, then, are elderly and infertile couples who want to get married to be denied as well?

* As homosexual behaviour has been documented in over 400 animal species,  & is therefore part of nature, how can Christians say it is 'unnatural'?

* = questions that were read out to the panel.

(Even though I was surprised that they chose my deliberately challenging questions, you'll note that those questions of mine that they didn't select are the ones that could possibly put Christian heterosexuals in a bad light.)
--------------------------

episodes.title: Scientology - Inside London's Dianetics Center
episodes.description:
London - March, 12 2015 (One day before L Ron Hubbard's birthday... coincidentally).

I've always been wary of Scientology and have given the 'Dianetics Center' on London's Tottenham Court Road a wide berth. Tales from ex-Scientologists about harassment, brainwashing, and constant demands for money (not to mention a central creed involving Space Aliens) has kept me from entering. 

But today I put on my innocent & curious face and went inside to ask all about this mysterious self-help religion, and was greeted by a very bubbly Hungarian woman who answered all my questions - and sat me down in front of a short film about the almost too-good-to-be-true life of their founder, L Ron Hubbard. (Did I say 'almost'?)

This is actually two encounters as I went back into the Center again later on that day.

I survived, and wasn't followed home. Next time - the big Scientology Church on Queen Victoria Street. I can already feel my Thetans quivering.

episodes.description:
Listen in on a chat on my local High Street, UK, with local JWs which focuses on the (very imminent) end of the world, known affectionately as 'Armageddon' to Witnesses. 

It seems that JWs have been expecting Armageddon from the moment their sect was founded in the late 1870s. Not just expecting it - but looking forward to it... in all its fiery, death-filled glory. When you're part of a small elect of chosen ones, you have reason to be happy.

episodes.description:
No, they're not the Men In Black, but when members of the evangelical Christian movement, the Plymouth Brethren, hit our streets to hand out 'turn or burn' tracts they almost always are dressed head to toe is solemn black (or white, tieless shirts). They called themselves Plymouth Brethren but I suspect they are the largely reclusive Exclusive Brethren, braving the evil world to save our souls by way of tiny leaflets.

When I  ask their views on it and allowing gay couples into their church, our chat becomes far more uncomfortable (for them). You can decide whether you think I got a reasonable answer out of them!

episodes.title: Evolution Vs Creationism with Baptist Street Preachers
episodes.description:
A local Baptist church is teeming with would-be evangelists, taking the (moral and actual) high ground on busy shopping thoroughfares to bellow and bluster about how we are all going to burn in Hell unless we accept the loving saviour, Jesus Christ.

They are there most days (except Sundays - duh) in groups. One preaches to the indifferent shoppers while others hand out tracts or offer booklets from an open suitcase.

After engaging them in conversations several times over the past few months, these guys know me pretty well. In this audio I approach their mini-bookstand and examine one of their tracts, which propounds many creationist arguments and explains how the banana was obviously designed by a God for Man's convenience.

You may want to skip to 1.40 - that is where I come in. :-)
